text: This is in the heart of Munich. I always consider these squares touristy and every cafe around it being a trap. However, this felt a lot less so. Cafe around the square are charming, crowded, and very busy. Definitely recommend to walk around the platz and explore!

title: Lots of people but nice music
text: Nice square in the very centre of Munich with a very nice fountain to the side of the square. Found the tourist information centre here where I was able to get a lot of very good recommendations about what to see in the few days I had in Munich. Too many people for my taste to spend a long time there, but there were some people on the street playing instruments and some people were singing along. Definitely added to the charm of the historical place.

title: Great meeting place for groups or as a starting point for your exploring!
text: The subway near our hotel let us off right in front of the New Rathaus/Glockenspiel area which made traveling back and forth to this area simple.  The Marienplatz puts you right in the middle of some of the most fabulous sites you will find in Munich.  You can easily walk to St. Peter's Church, walk through the Rathaus and wait for the Glockenspiel to chime.  There are lots of great shops down every street and you will also find the most amazing outdoor market where you will find anything from baked goods, flowers, delicatessen items, fruits and vegetables.  Make this this beginning point for your exploration of this great city.

title: Great Place to explore
text: This seems to be the central area in Munich with lots to see and do around this area. The main thing to see here is the Glockenspiel but there are plenty of museums and churches to look in.We came by just after Christmas so they were packing up the Christmas market that was here. Aside from the historical things to see here, there are plenty of food and shopping options. It is a must stop for someone who hasn't been here before to see some sights. There is also an information center close to the Glockenspiel entrance that we used here to get an idea of the surrounding area.

title: Fun place to walk around and explore
text: We took the train from the airport to the Marienplatz because it was easy to catch a cab to our hotel (its a busy area with lots of cabs driving by looking looking for passengers). We had a little time on our hands before checking in to the hotel so we walked around (suitcases in tow) exploring. It was a historic, busy, interesting place to with lots of eating and shopping options. You can even catch the hop on, hop off bus if youâ€™re looking to do some sightseeing that starts and ends at the Marienplatz.

title: Assolutamente bella
text: Marienplatz Ã¨ il fulcro e lo snodo principale e piÃ¹ importante della cittÃ . Dalla sua fermata metro passano tutte le linee. ha una forma quasi rettangolare. La piazza Ã¨ dominata da un edificio in stile gotico che prende tutto un lato della piazza: Ã¨ il Neues Rathaus (Nuovo municipio), imponente e stilisticamente spettacolare. Sotto i portici si trova l'Ufficio turistico principale della cittÃ  dove parlano anche italiano. Tutta la piazza Ã¨ circondata da importanti edifici tra cui lâ€™Altes Rathaus (Vecchio municipio). Al centro domina la Mariensaule (Colonna della Vergine) con in testa la statua dorata della Madonna con il bambino in braccio. Rappresenta la patrona della Baviera. Alla base sono raffigurati quattro putti nellâ€™atto di sconfiggere i mali come la peste, la guerra, lâ€™eresia e la fame. Essendo il centro della cittÃ  dalla piazza ci si puÃ² dirigere agevolmente in tutte le direzioni: per andare al Residenz, al Viktualmarket, alla Peterkirche, alla Frauenkirche, alla birreria Hofbrauhaus e in tanti altri posti.

title: Kurzausflug nach MÃ¼nchen
text: Wie fast jeden Tourist, hat es auch mich auf den Marienplatz verschlagen. Das Rathaus mit Glockenspiel ist natÃ¼rlich hier die Hauptattraktion fÃ¼r jeden Touristen und auch ich habe mich eingereiht in die Reihe der Fotografen. Man mÃ¶chte ja auch dieses Bauwerk fÃ¼r sich festhalten. Einige Lokale laden die Touristen zum verweilen ein und hatte bereits ihren Freisitz geÃ¶ffnet. Was mich jedoch stÃ¶rte, war die teilweise vorhandene Unsauberkeit und diese Pinkelecken, welche man Ã¼berall vorfand. Darum ziehe ich einen Punkt ab. Was ich auch stÃ¶rend empfand, waren die Bettler aus RumÃ¤nien. Da man die Masche kennt, sieht man dies auch mit einem kritischen Auge. Dennoch freue ich mich auf meinen nÃ¤chsten Besuch in MÃ¼nchen, denn dies wird nicht mein letzter gewesen sein.

text: Beautiful city Square with a number of historical buildings, churches, town hall and restaurants and breweries. Easily accessible by the s and u bahn.

title: Hard to review "the middle of the town"
text: Come to Munich, and you'll see Marienplatz. It's pretty much the middle. At ground level it's a lot of bustle, shops and slightly over priced restaurants ... but look UPWARDS and take in the amazing, beautiful architecture (while keeping a hand on your wallet: it is a big public space, remember)

title: It just happened to be Mardi Gras
text: I knew Tues, Feb. 25 was Mardi Gras this year, but my husband and I just happened to be in Munich's Marienplatz for a short visit. Wow, were we surprised! Great fun, lots of music, costumed revelers, all the shops closed at noon, restaurants were open. We ate at Hofbrauhaus, and the bands paraded through to cheers and dancing. Who knew?!

title: Great view of an dreamy place

title: Sempre bella
text: Verso sera, quando si accendono le luci, andate in fondo alla piazza. Quando chiudono i negozi ci sono sempre artisti di strada che deliziano con musica e performance piacevoli. Rossini e Donizetti compresi, se vi piace anche la musica colta...

title: Krasny orloj

title: The main place in Munich
text: If you come to Munich, you must visit this place. This place is surrounded by beautiful and old buildings but restored .The big building is the town hall. Twice in the morning you can watch a puppet show accompanied by music at the bell tower.It is recommended on a beautiful day to rise to the top of the bell tower for a beautiful view of the area

title: Nice
text: It is a beautiful, clean, and organized place. I guess it is more or less the touristic centre of the city, several cafes, restaurants and some souvenir shops. DON't go on Sundays, almost everything is closed except some restaurants and cafes

title: Must visit
text: This is the heart of town, not to be missed. Beautiful architecture of the City Hall and its Glockenspiel clock is the highlight, but it is just a starting point to many sights all around this square, one of the most beautiful in Europe.

text: We went there during Christmas, and the atmosphere was amazing. The streets were filled cabins that serve food and Christmas souvenirs. There are shops and restaurants, like Zara and so, all over the streets. Everything will be closed by 8pm though. Definitely worth a visit.

title: The heart of Munich.

title: Best town square.
text: There is so much to see, architecture , churches, glockenspiel, shopping, markets, not to mention the food!  Glockenspiel is a must see. Easily accessible by local train.  Also must have a beer at the Viktualienmarkt!

title: Visited Dec2019
text: We had a great day in Munich!  Did a short walking tour and then strolled around on our own.  The city was very visitor friendly.  I felt safe and it was easy to get around.

title: Time to watch the Glockenspiel
text: Get here early before the crowds . Even though I visited in winter it was still crowded for the Glockenspeil. Quite impressive and worth the wait.

title: Central square to the city. A lot of people and historic buildings to see.
text: This is the central sqaure of Munich. It was very busy with tourists and local people. There is a bell on the city hall with moving characters at 11am and 12. This is OK to watch, many people were there to see it. We also took the opportunity to climb a nearby clock tower, to get good views. I am not fond of heights, so did not feel particularly comfortable up there, but my boyfriend found it great and walked about taking photos! On a must do list for any visitor of Munich.

title: Try to go in December!
text: And be there at 11a or 2p to see the mechanical clock tower figures  in motion. The Christmas market booths are the nicest of the many we've visited in Europe - really beautiful. And the nearby Victualienmarkt is wonderful

title: Der Marienplatz ist das Herz von MÃ¼nchen
text: Am Marienplatz kÃ¶nnen sie nicht nur um 11.00 Uhr das Glockenspiel vom Rathausturm hÃ¶ren, sie kÃ¶nnen sich auch vom Turm MÃ¼nchen von oben ansehen. Neben dem neuen Rathaus steht das alte Rathaus das 1470-1475 im spÃ¤tgotischen Stil erbaut wurde. Der einstige Fest- und Tanzsaal im ersten Stock ist ein Meisterwerk der Gotik und absolut sehenswert. Im Advent findet im alten Rathaus eine Krippenausstellung statt, die auch immer sehr schÃ¶n ist. Vor dem Rathaus ist der Fischbrunnen. Im Fischbrunnen werden am Aschermittwoch die leeren Geldbeutel und das StadtsÃ¤ckel gewaschen auf daÃŸ sie sich aufs neue fÃ¼llen. Hier am Fischbrunnen findet auch der Metzgersprung statt bei dem Jungmetzger zum AbschluÃŸ ihrer Lehrzeit in das kÃ¼hle Nass des Fischbrunnens springen. FÃ¼r das leibliche Wohl ist am Marienplatz auch gesorgt und einen Einkaufsbummel  kÃ¶nnen sie hier auch beginnen, entweder Richtung Kaufinger/NeuhauserstraÃŸe oder in Richtung Feldherrnhalle wo sich die exklusiveren GeschÃ¤fte befinden.

title: The heart of Munich
text: Located in the city center. Is a square with many beautiful buildings. Great place to start your journey by underground, tram or bus.

title: Munich trip
text: Marienplatz is the heart of Munich. It's full of charm. The glocenspeil is truly majestic. It performs everyday at noon. Very busy place.

text: O local Ã© muito agradÃ¡vel mas movimentado. VÃ¡rios pontos turÃ­sticos situam-se no seu entorno. Na Neues Rathaus, em sua torre central, hÃ¡ um show de bonecos Ã s 12 horas e no final da tarde (neste Ãºltimo o horÃ¡rio varia conforme a estaÃ§Ã£o do ano).

title: Charming...
text: The Munich Old Town area s a delightful adventure.  There is so much to see and enjoy.Make sure you see the glockenspiel and the beer hall that is the heart of Octoberfest.

title: Linda Praca
text: Linda  Praca. Vale a pena pegar o tour que Ã© de graca ( mas tem que reservar antes) e andar pelos arredores.

title: Mooi plein
text: MÃ¼nchen bezocht tijdens een doortocht. Mooie, toeristische stad. Deze plaats trekt veel toeristen en je kan er geocachen.

title: IncreÃ­ble lugar Marien platz
text: No se la pueden perder, hay demasiado que ver y Neues Rathaus es un edificio hermoso con un espectÃ¡culo sin igual a las 11:05am y a las 12:05 md durante invierno.

title: Nice
text: Very good for a walk, shopping, coffee, beer it has everything. U bahn s bahn station.Best you walk till Stachus and dont get afraid to get lost in the streets around
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Glockenspiel is a must!!!
text: Marienplatz offers shopping, cafÃ©s and a whole lot of history.The gem of this square though is by far the famous Glockenspiel.  This is not your typical clock, it is Its two levels of carved figurines that play out scenes from Munich's history to music.Make sure to see what times it will be playing before you make your plans.  The times vary between the seasons.You can go to Youtube for a preview :-)

title: People watching
text: Had lunch here in Marienplatz  while people watching and waiting for the glockenspiel to start up! Beautiful square in Munich with superb architecture. It was very busy when we were there late July/early Aug but still wonderful. The restaurants in the square are quite pricey. I ordered the Bavarian white sausage, it tasted...uniqueğŸ¤”ğŸ¤­

title: Cafes, street music, shopping- has it all!
text: A short walk from Hotel Platzl, we spent a rainy afternoon under cover at an outdoor cafe people watching and chatting. Lovely!

title: Bellezza di monaco
text: Piazza meravigliosa centro principale e culturale della CittÃ . Da visitare il Duomo e il virtualmarket.

title: Beautiful with history, architecture and ambience
text: To be fair, we had an image in our minds as to how Marienplatz would look, feel and sound. It's because of Gabriel Knight 2: The Beast Within (and yes, I realize how nerdy that makes me sound!)At any rate, all the images we'd had in our heads went right out the window the second we stepped out of the Bahnhof and saw the millions of Christmas Market stalls in our faces.NOT that I'm complaining! I was in Christmas Market heaven. We visited Marienplatz several times over the course of our five-day stay. It was crowded - except for early in the morning, which was my favorite time to visit. We did visit some of the "local" type stores on the Platz, but avoided the chains we know from home. It was easy to get lost and turned around with all the stalls and the side streets, but it was an amazing adventure. Marienplatz served as a kind of "home base" for us while we were in Munich. It was comfortable, had a good variety of restaurants and shops, and had a wonderful vibe. I loved the history and the architecture, and how central it all was.I would love to go back in another season, to visit the Platz without the market stalls (did I really say that?), and to see the area in sun and warmth. To, you know, see it as it was depicted in Gabriel Knight. Nerd alert!

title: Plaza con mucha historia
text: Empezamos  ahÃ­ nuestros tours a pie. La parada ahi fue importante  porque  muchas cosas de la fundaciÃ³n  del partido Nazi ocurrieron ahi.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: El corazon de MÃ¼nchen
text: Imperdible e imprescindible pasear por esta plaza.Todo en ella es bello, el reloj del ayuntamiento con sus campanas y carrillon, la estatua de Maria, la historia.En pocas palabras un lugar obligado y bellisimo por el que hay que pasar!

title: Beautiful square
text: A beautiful square with markets and plenty to see and do. A lot of history and places to stop by at and enjoy the culture of Bavaria

title: The place to be
text: Itâ€™s the classic place to be in Munich. You have to come here to see the Glockenspiel, shop, see the market, enjoy the crowds, etc.

title: Ein Bedeutendes StÃ¼ck MÃ¼nchen
text: Ich gehe sehr gerne dort Spazieren und muss sagen es gehÃ¶rt zum Wahrzeichen MÃ¼nchens.Die Frauenkirche und auch alle anderen DenkmÃ¤ler sind auch bei Nacht immer wieder schÃ¶n zu beobachten.

title: Total Tourist Mob Scene
text: We were there during the Christmas season.  It was unbelievably crowded, the Christkindlmarkt stalls were very much geared to tourists and there were long lines for absolutely everything.  Most of the buildings are reconstructions as the Allies pretty much leveled Munich during WW2.

title: Buen lugar para pasear
text: Es un lugar hermoso para caminar y hacer sus compras de recuerdos, la arquitectura de los edificios la hacen un lugar excelente para fotografiar.

title: Tourist, and local central
text: The area was awash with Christmas market stalls selling everything from mulled wine to various local festive delicacies - lots of little wooden shed everywhere which helped to create a very festive atmosphere despite being situated in the main shopping street, full of designer/brand-name shops.Despite being full of people on Christmas Eve we never felt and danger of being pickpocketed, unlike similar places in different cities, but caution is - as always - advised.Get off the main street and about a block behind the New Town Hall, and by the cathedral, there are some very good and reasonably priced restaurants which are full of locals. Always a good sign as often centrally located restaurants in tourist areas are bad and expensive. We had lunch in this are on both Christmas Eve and Christmas Day (when admittedly there wasn't much choice apart from fast food chains) and yet weren't disappointed at all.

title: Accogliente
text: Non pensavo che il centro storico di Monaco di Baviera fosse cosÃ¬ bello. Maestoso e allo stesso tempo accogliente come un salotto. Quello che piÃ¹ mi ha colpito di questa cittÃ  Ã¨ che tutto, sia al centro che in periferia, Ã¨ talmente ben tenuto che sembra nuovo, appena fatto. Monumenti, piazze , strade, negozi, case, giardini. Ho pensato con un poâ€™ di tristezza che noi potremmo avere la stessa cura delle nostre cose.

title: Central spot to meet and explore the city
text: This is a great place to meet friends and explore the city together. Its buildings are magnificent and the shops well worth visiting.

title: Beautiful
text: I spent 2019 Christmas here.Beautiful buildings, cozy streets are a great experience.Within a few days I went back and forth to hear and see the bell.

title: Imperdibile
text: Cuore di Monaco Ã¨ tappa obbligata , come Ã¨ obbligatorio assistere al cambio di orario del meraviglioso ed unico orologio. Unica pecca Ã¨ la montagna di turisti che la invade. per assistere al cambio dell'ora Ã¨ meglio prendere posto 20 minuti prima in posizione strategica.

title: beautiful
text: worth a visit. stooped on history, architecture and charme. would go back immediately. we were lucky with the weather and enjoyed the outs side Cafe with fluewin and brazen

title: Great square.  Great clock that goes off every hour.  Lots of shops & space, & water features
text: Just great.  Wonderful clock that goes off every hour in their main town square tower.  Lots of shops, water features, space, light & enjoyment.  DEFINITELY go there.  Better than Salzburg, or any others we've seen in Europe.

title: 12 oclock
text: Get there at noon and watch the full chime program. It is cute.  Visit the amber shop below the clock. It is the oldest in the area.

text: Fantastic European experience, people shops, food, shops, beer, shops, busking and some spectacular architecture. Must do anytime you visit Munich.

title: Consigliata
text: Visitata in periodo natalizio Ã¨ davveero suggestiva di giorno ed anche la sera. Spettacolare il movimento dell'orologio animato della torre.Consigliata

title: Beautiful
text: Marienplatz is beautiful there is no denying that. There are plenty of shops, eateries, and of course beer houses. That being said majority of the shops are closed on Sundays so plan accordingly!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Marienplatz
text: Love this place you can spend the entire day just walking around the plaza. Thereâ€™s so much to do in walking distance justa. Few minutes is a market w amazing German food you have to try. About 10 min walking is the palace beautiful place. Recomp

title: The heart of Munich
text: Have visited Munich at Christmas time this year and of course one of the musts was Marienplatz with its wonderful Christmas market. We loved the stands, the decorations,the smells and tastes of the German gingerbread cookies, the hot wine called Gluewein and the roasted sweet almonds.. The square is surrounded by medieval buildings like the Rathaus and endless shopping opportunities and restaurants for everyone's taste and budget. I almost forgot! You must try the Bavarian Weisswurst! So yummy! In short, I am sure you will have a great time!

title: Bellissima
text: Bella piazza che merita una visita.Ãˆ poi alle 11.00 e alle 12.00 dopo il classico suono delle campane c Ã¨ il carillon a metÃ  torre con dei pupazzi che suonano e ballano una musica della Bavaria.

title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful location but we first visited on a Sunday and everything was closed. We also went to the square for New Year's Eve. We got there at 9pm and nothing was happening. All the shops were closed. No music or entertainment or activities for revellers. Reservations are a must for restaurants near the square on NYE, of course. Fireworks are no longer allowed to be set off in the square so if you are looking for that on New Year's Eve in Munich, pick another location in the city. All that being said, Marienplatz is a must see on your visit to Munich.

title: Great pedestrian only walk in Munich
text: Many restaurants, beer halls, shopping of various kinds. Great area to spend a few hours while in Munjch.

title: Da vedere
text: Il carillon suona alle 11 e alle 12. Dura 5-6 minuti ed Ã¨ carino e suggestivo. Una musica suona e dei personaggi si muovono sulla torre che affaccia sulla piazza.

title: Maiestatica
text: Piazza imponente e spettacolare, il centro nevralgico della cittÃ  da dove partire e proseguire nella visita delle varie attrazioni. Unico lo spettacolo del Glockenspiel.

title: Spettacolare
text: Magnifica piazza principale di Monaco,racchiude sia il vecchio che il nuovo municipio,con in mezzo la colonna della statua di Santa Maria. Bella da qualsiasi scorcio e via di accesso .Salire sulla torre dell'orologio Ã¨ come toccare il cielo con un dito in piÃ¹ si gode di un ottima vista della cittÃ  intera!

title: Piazza molto grande e bella
text: Piazza famosa per la sua cattedrale che Ã¨ anche sede del comune di Monaco.Davvero caratteristica e piena di negozi tradizionali bar birrerie e boutique

title: Che dire...
text: Piazza bellissima,che dire?!Merita una giornata intera tutto il giro del centro.. Ma che freddo che era! ğŸ˜…

title: Munichâ€™s main attraction
text: This is the main place to be visited in Munich. It is a lovely places with several old buildings and shopping places surrounding the area. Nice to enjoy looking at the buildings while shopping.  You can get everything here near the luxury shopping goods, trams, gifts and souvenirs, cafes, etc.  Interesting!

title: einer der schÃ¶nsten Orte in MÃ¼nchen
text: hier muÃŸ man gewesen sein - und auch unbedingt auf den Turm des alten Peter Steigen um den Marienplatz von oben zu sehen

title: A delight at Christmas
text: Visiting the Christkindl Markt was a highlight.  The vibe, the food!Also well worth the visit to see the old and new Rathauses, the Glockenspiel etc.

title: First Place OI Think Of When I Think Muenchen!!!
text: I first saw this in 1973 when I was in Germany as part of and Army Mission.  This is very much the embodiement of traditional old German craftsmanship and the charm of this large city.

title: Fantastic Christmas market but also very nice in the summer!
text: If you have a chance to visit Munich during December it has many Christmas markets and Marienplats is one of the best.Marienplats is during the summer a very nice place to spend time among the restaurants and cafes. Do not forget to walk over to Virtualien markt when you are at Marienplats. (2 minute walk)There you can find all fresch fruit, vegetables, cheese, handicrafts etc during all year.

title: Nice to see
text: Since you are in Munich, this is one of the "must see" in the city. I t is surrounded with several important buildings. It is a meeting point and the place for christmas markets.

title: Una plaza preciosa
text: Munich es preciosa, y esta plaza, con sus tÃ­picas construcciones alemanas, es maravillosa y de visita imprescindible

title: LA PIAZZA
text: La piazza centrale, snodo della metro e tappa obbligatoria. Il nuovo municipio occupa la scena principale. Bellissima. Piazza pulitissima ed ordinata.

title: It's a must
text: This is the area that you must visit if you go to Munich, good shops , restaurants , nice vibe, with a lot of history

title: Centre of Bavaria.
text: Centre of Bavaria, most famous place in Munich. Always happy to have a stroll enjoy the walk between its beautiful allies, old architecture, and crowded street.

title: Passeio
text: Muito linda a praÃ§a!!! JÃ¡ conhecia tinha vindo jÃ¡ . Mas Ã© muito bom voltar e agora com frio. Dia de Reis tudo fechado , mas mto bom passear .

title: Le coeur de la ville
text: EntourÃ©e de monuments prestigieux, cette place est splendide. On y sent battre le coeur de Munich. Le nouveau Rathaus, l'ancien, la cathÃ©drale, les ruelles adjacentes, tout a Ã©tÃ© rÃ©parÃ© Ã  l'identique. A ne pas manquer sous aucun prÃ©trexte.

title: Marienplatz molto bella
text: Gli ultimi giorni di dicembre siamo stati ancora a Monaco di Baviera, dietro alla Marienplatz. Anche se e sempre abbastanza affollata, Ã¨ pulita, offre tanti servizi come la metropolitana, ristoranti, bar, tanti belli locali dove ripararsi anche dal freddo Ã¨ dalla pioggia. Ci Ã¨ piaciuta molto.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Nice retail area, usual high street shops seen everywhere else. Some food outlets in the side streets.
text: generic shops as seen in most city shopping areas worldwide these days. There were some good food outlets and bars on many of the side streets, better than the usual chain food outlets. Crowded but pleasant enough.

title: Lovely
text: Visited during Christmas and it was fantastic. There were a lot of Christmas stalls in the plaza and you can stroll leisurely with a cup of mulled wine. There were less people in the morning, so if you prefer not to bump into strangers from time to time then go visit the plaza in the morning.

title: Vacanze di capodanno
text: Abbastanza bella parecchi ristoranti buone pasticcerie interessante e belle le chiese ottima le birrerie.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Excellent
text: This area is very beautiful. I really loved it. Thefeeling you get when you are there is just not real. Great place for pictures.

title: Beautiful Christmas Markets
text: When you walk into this square you are overwhelmed at all the lights and the beauty of the Christmas Market. Our first time and we absolutely loved walking through the markets and getting a real feel for Munich. The lighting is beautiful.

title: Must see!
text: Great shopping, beautiful architecture. Donâ€™t miss the Glockenspiel! The Christmas tree was still up along with other lights and it was breathtaking! Perfect for photos or to get a quick glimpse of the best square in town.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Nice place to visit and walk around the entire area
text: Nice place to visit and walk around the entire area.It's a must-visit place in Munich.I did a guided walking tour, which helped me to learn about the area a lot.

title: Un resumen de Munich
text: Es una plaza entretenida por donde se ve el paso del tiempo a pesar de las mÃºltiples reconstrucciones. El ayuntamiento es para mi el edificio mÃ¡s impresionante de MÃºnich a nivel de arquitectura pasada. El carrillÃ³n siempre embruja a pequeÃ±os y mayores. Es mÃ¡s largo de lo que parece pues se suceden dos fases. El carrillÃ³n superior y despuÃ©s el inferior. Casi 15 minutos de duraciÃ³n.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Highlight in Munich
text: This is a must see in Munich. The crowds gather on the hour so get there in plenty of time. The building is very gothic looking and fascinating watching the "show".

title: It s a MUST

Se non vi spaventano i quasi 400 gradini per salire, per soli 3 Euro godrete davvero il migliore panorama della cittÃ .

title: Einfach schÃ¶n
text: Man muss sich in die Mitte des Platzes stellen und dann ganz langsam drehen. Ein Blick ist schÃ¶ner als der andere. Der Platz ist immer voll, trotzdem hat man nicht das GefÃ¼hl erdrÃ¼ckt zu werden. Wir waren heute bei eiskalten Wetter und strahlend blauen Himmel auf den Marienplatz und es war wieder ein schÃ¶nes GefÃ¼hl trotz der KÃ¤lte. Wir "drehen" uns immer so, dass wir in die SeitenstraÃŸe zum FeinkostgeschÃ¤ft Dallmayr kommen, essen da eine Kleinigkeit und der Tag ist perfekt.

title: Cuore pulsante
text: Marienplatz Ã¨ il cuore pulsante di Monaco di Baviera Ã¨ il centro della cittadina, in questa Piazza si affacciano il vecchio Municipio e il nuovo municipio. Quest'ultimo in stile neolitico, ha una torre con orologio e carillon che alle 11 e alle 12 d'inverno, mentre d'estate anche alle 21, si mette in movimento, le statuine mostrano la giostra dei Cavalieri durante la festa di matrimonio di Guglielmo V e i Bottai  festeggiano la salvezza dalla peste, alla fine il Gallo d'Oro muove le ali e canta 3 volte.Sotto la piazza si trovano la metro e i treni della s-bhan

title: Everyones "Must See" in Munich
text: Seemingly at the center of the old town in Munich, Marienplatz is rather the hub for commercial and sighting activity when visiting Munich. We were there shortly before Christmas so the Christ Kindal Markets were in full bloom. The Platz makes good starting point for self guided walking tours of the numerous great cultural attractions. As a special interest factor it is a prime point to get to the Uban public transit system.

title: Capodanno
text: Sui siti che parlano di questa piazza in genere non Ã¨ molto chiaro  cosa succeda in piazza a capodanno. Infatti molti, tra cui noi, credono che vi sia una specie di festa organizzata con tanto di fuochi d artificio. In realtÃ  NON Ãˆ COSÃŒ. I Fuochi eventualmente sono sparati dai cittadini che lo desiderano, ma quest anno c'Ã¨ ne sono stati pochissimi e la piazza, dopo lo scoccare della mezzanotte, si Ã¨ liberata quasi subito. Nelle piazze adiacenti, invece, molta festa, molti fuochi!! Quindi consiglio di appostarsi direttamente altrove per un degno fine anno.Inoltre, il carillon della torre funziona alle 11 e alle 12, mentre alle 21 solo piccola ninna nanna deludente.

title: Heart of Historic Munich
text: For most of December, the square is transformed into a Christmas spectacle, notably with the expansive Christmas market, but also with many of the shops and sights along the square putting window displays, Christmas decorations, etc. We came here on two different occasions on this trip - one during the day on a Friday, and another on a Saturday night. It was pretty crowded both times, particularly on the Saturday, so plan accordingly if that is an issue for you. While it certainly had a heavy tourist feel to it, there was still an impressive variety of food and retail options in and around the Marienplatz.

title: Pasar natal yang meriah
text: Menyenangkan, melihat alun-alun kota munich yang memiliki menara jam dengan boneka yang dapat bergerak, kami datang saat terdapat pasar natal yang meriah. Banyak penjual makanan dan minuman khas jerman serta pernak pernik natal.

title: Busy place with an amazing atmosphere!!
text: It is a pleasure walking at Marienplatz. This is like an iconic place in Munich. It has all the major stores, Hofbrauhaus the beer place is also worth a visit. The Platz just takes you in and makes you feel at home. A whole day can be spent here, entertaining you own self.

title: Absolute beauty at Christmastime!
text: We loved walking the plaza a few nights after dinner.  Even after the Christmas market has closed and cleaned up, we enjoyed our walk each night.

title: Bella e affascinante
text: Una bella piazza, il cuore della cittÃ , con il bel municipio in gran mostra che metiterebbe sicuramente una visita.

text: Las comunicaciones desde la EstaciÃ³n Central a Salzburgo, Oberamergau,...Castillo Rey Loco son excelentes. El centro lo puedes hacer totalmente a pie.

title: Niente di che
text: Nulla di che, piccola piazza su cui si affaccia sia la frauenkirke che la Chiesa di San pietro, consiglio la vista dal campanile di quest'ultima

title: Beautiful place
text: A beautiful place with amazing bars, including the world famous Hofbrau haus and  great restaurants and shops. One of the best German restaurants I have ever been in is called Nurnberger Bratwurst Glockl am Dom , beautiful food lovely staff and amazing family Bavarian atmosphere, 125 year old rustic cosy building with lots of interesting rooms to eat and drink in. I never tire of MarienPlatz. book tables in advance at weekends as its very hard to get a table at night, practically anywhere. Very very busy but well worth it.

title: Viaje familiar a Alemania
text: Disfrutamos de la ciudad de Munich y el fantÃ¡stico paisaje BÃ¡varo. Nos encantÃ³ su entorno, monumentos, parques, costumbres y sobre todo las bier garten.

title: Magica
text: Es una plaza impresionante en el corazÃ³n de munich, miles de personas, bares. Restaurantes, iglesias...el ayuntamiento que es una preciosidad, tiene un carillÃ³n que toca las campanas y baila a las 12 de la maÃ±ana... no te cansas de verla y pasar al cruzar a otros sitios.

title: 50 aniversario
text: Espectacular, a todo aquel que le guste la cerveza .Ciudad genial para pasear, todo llano.Un poco liosa por compartir asfalto con los tranvÃ­as.Volveremos

title: Da visitare!
text: Da ammirare se si passa da Monaco! Un'opera d'arte che lascia a bocca aperta! Consiglio di aspettare le ore 11 e ore 12 per godere del carillon animato situato nella torre dell'orologio (Glockenturme)
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Still a local and buzzing food and drink market in the middle of the city
text: We always visit the Marienplatz on every visit to Munich and have done so for the past 20+ years. Nothing changes it just gets better. Very interesting variety of food, provisions, drinks, et all to buy, of if you are just tourists like us, just great to sit, have a drink and people watch

title: Place which must not miss
text: If you at Munich then Marienplatz its 1 of the location which you must not miss. The surrounding building show the histories of Bavaria land. Most of the event in Munich will held at this place and you'll definitely be delighted by their environment. This area also surrounded by shop for you to shop around. The Glockenspiel play ( Clock show ) will start at 11am and 5pm daily ( winter got different time ). The Rathaus-Glockenspiel its the 4th largest Clock tower in Europe.

title: Deslumbrante
text: Fiquei encantada ao chegar na Marienplatz pela primeira vez. Era noite e prÃ³ximo do Natal, entÃ£o estava tudo muito iluminado e enfeitado pelo lindÃ­ssimo mercado natalino. A Neue Rathaus Ã© simplesmente deslumbrante, juntamente com a St Peter Kirche. ImperdÃ­vel.

title: Christmas Market
text: Very nice area which was easy to get around.  Lots of beautifully decorated stalls as well as nice shops.

title: Un monde fou
text: Place blindee en cette pÃ©riode de Noell. Pas mal de commerces dans le coin. Tout ce qu'il faut pour boire et manger ! DÃ©coration de Noel impeccable. A ne pas rater ! incontournable

title: Living up to its reputation
text: Well worth it. It is a busy place now and full of tourists, but it just keeps on giving.Every which way you look is shop till you drop, from the finest to the high street, nothing is missing.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Beautiful area fun for all
text: The glockenspiel was incredible especially the knights on horses! My son is 7 and watched the full time. What an incredible creation. The whole area served us all well-  beautiful architecture and history and churches for me- great food for us all and shopping.

title: Beautiful Square With Lots of Action
text: I really enjoyed going through this square during the holiday season! Lots of little stalls in the Christmas market and beautiful architecture to stare at while I'm walking around. I broke my phone but was able to get a new one at the Apple Store so there is that and of course the Glockenspiel is very charming to see! This basically is the heart of Munich.

title: Marienplatz - the heart and soul of Munich
text: Obviously, you will want to research the times that the Glockenspiel  will put on its daily show.  You will find the times on the internet.  Don't be late, and bring your video camera.  This is a wonderful place to visit any time of the year, but especially so during the Christmas season.

title: Munich Old Town center
text: This is the kind of place I always want to see when I'm traveling in Europe. Old, traditional, well kept, clean, crowded and smelling culture and history.I just love the statue of Virgin Mary in the center of the square. Check the details about the clock show. The time varies a little depending on the season. The square gets very crowded and it gets hard to find a good place. It is also relatively long (more than 5 minutes you may get tired of holding a camera). A good tip is to see it from the Old Peter's Tower.

title: Very nice!
text: One of the best square in the world! I really liked the atmosphere (we were there in Christmas time) and the cathedral. The Carrion show has to be seen: they do one every hour. Recommend the tour of the church

title: Amazing place!!
text: Christmas marketing were unbelievable we had the best time. All the people were so friendly also, for sure worth a visit

title: A mix
text: Of old and new. The market stalls were packed and it was a great Christmas environment. Worth strolling all around.

title: Bella
text: Appena arrivati a Monaco ci siamo fiondati a Marienplatz, periodo natalizio con le bancarelle (dalle quali mi aspettavo di piÃ¹) quindi piazza super affollata. Caratteristico il carillon, da vedere

title: Very Gothic
text: Large square dominated by the New City Hall, famous for its Glockenspiel.  There are shops and banks on the other side of the square, with St Mary's Column in the center.  Tourist Information Office is right next to the City Hall.  Easy to get to as there's a metro station right in the square.  The Christmas Market had just opened while I was there and I got to see the Christmas tree lighting ceremony too.  One of the most famous sights in Munich and well worth a visit.

title: Pretty crowded with Christmas market
text: I visited Marienplatz before but in another month.  Marienplatz in December was cluttered with shops in Christmas market. It was experiential to visit and have Gluwein and/or Kinder punch. Also, sausages were optonal to fancy restaurants.

Unica nota stonata il fatto che, dal primo pomeriggio della vigilia e il giorno di Natele, i mercatini nonchÃ© i negozi e ristoranti chiudono!!! Monaco Ã¨ una cittÃ  molto tradizionalista della cultura bavarese

title: Un posto particolare
text: In questi giorni la piazza Ã¨ piena di turisti per i famosi mercatini natalizi. Li puoi trovarci sia gli addobbi natalizi che le bancarelle dei prodotti locali. L'attrazione della piazza Ã¨ perÃ² il carillon che, alle 11 e alle 12, suona in modo particolare diventando il punto piÃ¹ attrattivo della piazza. title: My first Christmas market
text: We just visited this place very close to Christmas day. Very vibrant, so many to see and to enjoy. Gluchwine is a must to try. The place surfound by beautiful building make the Christmas atmosphere ebery corner

title: Beautiful square but mostly overcrowded
text: Marienplatz is a beautiful sightseeing and certainly a must when you visit Munich, especially as it is also connected to the Viktualienmarkt, a permanent market with lots of regional and international food and non-food. However I may have been to Marienplatz 10 times in the last two years and it has always been completely overcrowded with tourists waiting for the famous The Glockenspiel or just blocking your way. So on one hand beautiful and on the other hand overcrowded mass tourism...

title: Munich Landmark
text: Probably coming here is a must if you are in Munich. But there isn't much here to see. The new town hall building is impressive and makes a great photo background. The Christmas market here is good. There are also some Bavarian restaurants you can try in this area.

title: Lovely square
text: We went for the Christmas Markets so it was really busy in the square. Nice fountains and a subway station make it an easy place to get to

title: Great Christmas Market in December.
text: This is one of the largest Christmas Markets in Munich. Marienplatz is a lively place and offers many shopping opportunities besides the Christmas Market. It also has the Glockenspiel which is unique. It is only rung three times per day. Many good restaurants are available. It is crowded especially in the evening, so pack your patience and be prepared for a leisurely trek through the market.

title: Marienplatz
text: Marienplatz is the main squere in Munich which is surrounded by very beautiful edificies from 18th century.Also you have the opportunity to explore the Neues Rathaus which is one of the siginificant buildings in Munich

title: Marienplatz and the Christmas Market was great
text: Marienplatz and the Christmas Market was great and we had a great time in the huge crowds at the markets.  What an experience.

title: Festive
text: We spent hours looking around the Christmas markets as there are so many types of food to eat and plenty of mulled wines to drink. I enjoyed it the most in the evening as you can appreciate the Christmas lights more and it is generally busier in later hours. The square has some beautiful buildings, and would be good to visit during the summer as well as winter.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Excellent Christmas Market
text: I have been to Munich a couple of times in different seasons and the Marienplatz is where we found ourselves gravitating back to. Itâ€™s the central hub to the old town and has a wonderful atmosphere. But the Christmas market here is something else. It was wonderful- full of both tourists and locals, looking for the best glÃ¼hwein. When going to Munich, the Marienplatz is step 1.

title: Marienplatz is the hub of the city
text: It is touristy, it is crowded but it is a must see. You are standing in front of the glockenspiel (New town hall), around the corner from St. Peterâ€™s church and if youâ€™re lucky to be there in December youâ€™re in the middle of one of many Christmas markets. So much history in a few square blocks. I recommend taking one of the free walking tours to get a fun overview.For great views pay 4â‚¬ to take an elevator up the tall spire of New Town hall or pay 3â‚¬ to take 300 steps to the top of St Peterâ€™s spire. Both amazing views!

title: Lovely place

title: Always a Favorite, especially during Christmas Markets!
text: A lively square with many sights. Lots of history and culture to be found in a close proximity. Lots of tourists, but for obvious reasons. Some great and iconic restaurants around the square. Simply magical at Christmas.

title: Christmas fabulous
text: We were lucky enough to be in Munich at Christmas time. Marienplatz is Christmas wonder at its best. Very busy with families and adults both nights we were there. Christmas treats and decorations abound. More beer and wine than you could drink is available. If you want to keep the novelty glasses (you pay for them as you buy your drink but this is refunded if you return the glass) be sure to keep them out of site as you leave or they may be taken from you to get the refund. Good family fun for the evening.

title: Christmas joy
text: You will see Marian Column, the beautiful clock tower with dancing figures, unique examples of  neo gothic architecture in New Rathaus and St. Peter's Church.  We experienced the joy of Christmas market with gorgeous Christmas tree and stalls selling ornaments, traditional food and mulled wine (GlÃ¼hwein).

title: Very good sightseeing and Christmas markets
text: We recently visited Munich and found ourselves at Marienplatz on numerous occasions, enjoying the sightseeing opportunities in the area as well as the annual Munchner Christkindlmarkt (Christmas Market) being held here at this time of year. Marienplatz is where you find the beautiful Neo-Gothic Neues Rathaus, the earlier Altes Rathaus, St. Peter's Church as well as attractive fountains and monuments such as the MarienSaule (Marien Column). Most interesting and something well worth making plans to see is the 11am and 12pm chiming clock performances of Glockenspiel which is built into the clock tower of Neues Rathaus. During December, you can also enjoy the annual Christmas market here at Marienplatz. There is a giant Christmas tree setup in the middle of the square, which is filled with stalls selling traditional and season foods, mulled wine as well as Christmas ornaments, decorations and other items of interest. The holiday market provides a good way to spend another hour or so at and around Marienplatz while in addition to intended sightseeing endeavours you have in the area.

title: A sight to see
text: Marienplatz was fully of pretty christmas shops and good smells, and the Town Hall building was a sight to see. Very nice architecture and design; unfortunately I was not there to see the clock tower show.The area had a lot of people, but it wasn't too crowded.

title: Crowded but Festive
text: We enjoyed visiting Marienplatz and the Christmas Markets.  It was very busy (except on Sunday when the shops are closed) but the holiday vibe was in full swing.  Fun place to hang out with the locals.

title: Christmas markets galore
text: Between Karlsplatz and Marienplatz is the place to be if you like Christmas markets. There are a myriad of vendors who sell everything from Christmas souvenirs and gluhwein to bratwursts. Something for everyone and historic buildings to boot. This plaza is where youâ€™ll find St. Michaels church, the iconic double spired Frauenkirche, and town hall , Neues Rathaus. Photo ops galore day or night as these buildings are lit up.

title: Busy but beautiful place
text: Wonderful to walk around Marienplatz and enjoy the atmosphere during Christmas. Easy walk from tram stations.

title: Tremendous Christmas Tree and markets
text: The tree is spectacular set against the town hall building and at 5.30pm a brass band played from the balcony.  The main market was in the square itself, but there are a few splinter markets on the side streets too. As good as any I've seen before.

title: Beautiful square great Christmas markets
text: This is a very busy square with extensive Christmas markets . The clock on the Tower means that lots of people stand in the. Square to listen to the bells and watch the figures go round. There are beautiful buildings all around the square and shops with seasonal displays.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Great location
text: Has everything to offer - food, drink, shopping and history.  If you go in Nov and Dec it has a fab Xmas market

title: magic place
text: It is simply a magic place (that it is always packed!). However, the building is really impressive and at 12.00 it is possible to see and listen to the music from the carillon.

title: Day visit from Salzburg - Christmas Market
text: Came on the train from Salzburg, then took the S Bann straight to Marienplatz. Very busy Christmas market in a great setting - lots of stalls - unfortunately no snow which always makes a Christmas market IMHO

title: Go for the Christmas Market
text: The Marienplatz is transformed during late November and December to a wonderful Christmas market, with stands set up to buy handmade Christmas ornaments and gifts, and to sell street food and the special â€œGluhweinâ€ or spiced, hot red wine. In the Christmas season the Gluhwein is a â€œmust doâ€ activity - on a cold evening buy a little ceramic cup of the hot liquid (8 Euro - but you get 4 back when you return the cup). Itâ€™s not as extensive as the larger Christmas markets in, for example, Nuremberg, but it is also not as crowded and you get a little bit of everything here!

title: Purely commercial.
text: I donâ€™t know what we were expected but hoped to be imbued with the Christmas spirit. But sadly we found it generally lacking. There were numerous stalls generally selling over-priced decorations, sausages and mulled wine. Despite the huge crowds, there was a total lack of Christmas music or charity. Even our small local mall manages to give you the Salvation Army brass band playing carols. Where were the choirs or German oompah bands in Munich? Iâ€™m afraid the Marienplatzn was very much a purely commercial experience.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: bella piazza
text: la piazza non Ã¨ molto grande ma la bella architettura del municipio la valorizza, io sono stato lÃ¬ per l'Immacolata e quindi la piazza era piena delle bacarelle del Mercatino di Natale

title: Marienplatz Christmas Market
text: Spent time here on all 4 days in Munich. Wonderful buildings surround the Christmas market which is superb. So many stalls to view or sample the wares of. Great atmosphere especially at night. Would recommend a visit during the market season.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: We stayed to see the Christmas market!? - what a mistake
text: We had a business trip to Munich in early December.  Since we had never visited as a couple, or during December, we made the choice to stay to visit the Christmas markets.  While Munich was wonderful, the markets were a complete waste of time.  Maybe I had the wrong expectation, but I was expecting a cute market with lots of lovely local foods and local craft stalls.  Man, was I wrong!It was all cheap stuff or pre-packaged goods you might finds anywhere.  What a waste of our time!  We really enjoyed walking around the neighborhoods of Munich, and we encourage everyone to enjoy that trip.  But, for Marienplatz and the Christmas markets - don't waste your time.

title: Christmas Market
text: We came to Munich to visit the Christmas Market.  There were many markets, the largest of them in Marienplatz.  We enjoyed all the stalls and bought lots of Christmas trinkets.  There was a large Christmas Tree in the square and when the lights came on in the evening as it was getting dark the area was beautiful.

title: Beautiful Town Square
text: The architectural details of the immense New Town Hall make "Mary's Square" so beautiful.  Everyone who visits Munich gathers here to people watch or grab a bite to eat in one of the many outside seating cafes.  You can feel the exciting pulse of the city as you stand in the middle of the square and take in the 360 degree views.

title: Especially attractive due to Xmas market.
text: More of a high street than a square.  Pedestrianised, surrounded by shops, restaurants and bars.  This time of the year, the main Xmas market in Munich is located here, an event that makes it more attractive especially at night when everything is lit up.  Easily one can spend few hours walking around, with plenty to eat and drink.

text: Il sole la rende magica completata dalle bancarelle natalizie e dall' albero di Natale spettacolare, molto viva cosi come tutte le strade che da essa si dipartono o arrivano.

title: Gorgeous
text: Marienplatz is beautiful and the town hall is stunning. We were lucky to be here when the Christmas market was on which made it even better but would love to return in the summer.  The Christmas market was amazing but there's loads of shops in this part of town too. At 5.30pm there's live music from a balocny on the town hall so gather round with your gluwhein. We walked down Petersplatz, crossed the road and came to another market which was lovely too.

title: Large Christkindlmarkt!
text: We visited in late November and the market was in full swing, extending to various streets off the Marienplatz.  Don't plan to shop on Sundays, because most of the stores are closed except for the Christmas market stalls.

title: December is Christmas Market

title: Too crowded Christmas Market
text: I have visited Marienplatz multiple times and its always overcrowded.  The 2019 Christmas Market is no exception.  We spent our time trying to wormhole our way through crowds, baby strollers, and more crowds and more baby strollers.  We could barely see the booths because of the people standing in front of them, not moving, not buying, just standing there.  I keep hearing about how Christmas markets are â€œmagicalâ€.  Well, not this one, unless your idea of magical is playing a game of frogger through thousands of people.  I have since found some magical Christmas markets, much smaller in scale, in Germany, but Iâ€™m not telling, because then they wonâ€™t be magical anymore.

text: There were so many people and very crowded - but no problems at all.MÃ¼nich is a wonderful friendly and safe city. â€œGet you guideâ€ - Matt - originally from Canada but now in passionate love with MÃ¼nich - took us on a fantastic almost 3 hours walking tour in the city. title: Christmas Market at Marienplatz
text: We had a great time at the Marienplatz Christmas Market. There were so many delicious food items and lots of interesting Christmas items (decorations, ornaments, toys, etc) for sale. It was a wonderful experience.

title: A walking visit
text: Marienplatz is amazing place to visit its a Marvellous Beautiful City Centre  and its the worth the visit will not be disappointed its the best part of Munich so many shops to look at and see  they rebuilt after WWII of the way going back to how things were

title: A very beautiful square!
text: Numerous buildings with ancient  stories inside them. There were a lot of people in the weekend and,especially, there were a lot of people in the numerous shops.

title: Beautiful Christmas Market
text: Had the wonderful opportunity to visit this week. Christmas Markets were abound in various areas of town. The sights, smells, and beautiful displays were amazing. Fun to walk around the markets sampling gingerbread, hot wine and tasty treats. Craftsmanship excellent. Perfect way to spend a few hours enjoying Christmas fun in Germany.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Worth a visit
text: Marienplatz is the main plaza in the old part of the city center. It is a pedestrian-only area. There are beautiful old historic buildings on and nearby this plaza, along with very many shops and restaurants. It was beautiful both in the day and at night. We were not able to see the Ratskeller glockenspiel in action (only 11:00 am and noon at this time of year) and just missed the Christmas Market by one day. Nearby parking is limited and streets are difficult to navigate, so it is best enjoyed if you are able to walk some distance.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Very beautiful city centre
text: Marienplatz is one of the most beautiful part of Munich, a nice place to wander and do some shopping. Some of the oldest churches in the city are nearby. A must visit once you are in Munich

title: Beautiful area
text: Gotta go here to the center of Munich.  They rebuilt after WWII with the mindset of going back to how things were.

title: Tutto bello tanto caos!
text: Sono stato con la mia famiglia in visita ai mercatini di Natale,piazza molto bella,municipio maestoso ma abbiamo trovato una marea di gente.Difficile persino camminare,file interminabili pre mangiare qualcosa,anche la galleria Kaukof piena all'inverosimile....da ritornaci in periodi piu' tranquilli,ma merita.

title: Christmas market
text: Wow folks a must do if you travel to Europe. So many things to do and food to eat. The gluwine is excellent but if you want a deal on sausages just go to some of the regular shops and buy the same sausage for about $1 or $2 cheaper. The gluwine has to be bought in the market though. Try the cherry wine with rum.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

text: Bellissima Marienplatz... imponente e maestosa!!!! Io avendola vista solo in tv/ internet ne sono rimasta davvero colpita

title: Christmas Market!
text: Visited the Christmas Market in this beautiful location. Absolutely gorgeous right in the center of the city under the town hall with the giant Christmas tree, so many sights, sounds, and smells. Many nice ornaments to buy. Look out for the ones in the Erzgebirge- they are the real deal. Donâ€™t buy cheap as many are made in China! The GlÃ¼hwein is delicious, the gebrannten Mandeln (roasted sugar coated almonds), potato pancakes (oh my!), Bratwurst in a roll..... I could go on and on. At approximately 5:30pm live musicians perform Christmas music on one of the higher floors of the Rathaus for all in the square below to see and hear.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Upscale shopping.  Christmas decorating beginning.
text: A fun place to stroll around with several churches nearby plus a number of great restaurants and bars.  Stores are similar in USA for most part.

title: Un lugar muy emblematico.
text: Es imposible  irse de Munich y no conocer un lugar tan maravilloso con el ayuntamiento nuevo y el viejo en la misma plaza y sus paradas de Navidad, encantador.

title: Amazing history and architecture.
text: Amazing history and architecture. Just be careful on weekends where there is a bit more of a seedy crowd.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Magnificent do not miss
text: First view is if city hall wow  mist ornate and beautiful. We were there for Christmas markets. Amazing the atmosphere and scenery.  Everyone friendly smiling lots of places to eat
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: La piazza di Maria.
text: Bellissima piazza che agli inizi del 1300 per volontÃ  di Ludovico il Bavaro ricevette il Diritto di Mercato, ospitando in questo modo i maggiori eventi pubblici infatti si chiamava piazza mercato. Agli inizi del 1800 a causa di una grande epidemia di colera i cittadini pregarono la Vergine Maria affinchÃ© terminasse tale flagello, fu cosÃ¬ che venne dato il nome di Marienplatz. Le attrazioni piÃ¹ belle sono certamente lâ€™Altes Rathaus, il vecchio municipio, poi la colonna di  Maria e la Fischbrunner, la fontana del pesce e infine lo spettacolare nuovo municipio col il Glockenspiel il grande carillon. Noi abbiamo visitato gli affollati mercatini di Natale tutti addobbati e pronti a offrire i loro prodotti culinari e artistici molto belli.

title: Christmas market
text: Went there for a bit of shopping and the currently running Christmas market but it was packed and then it w drizzling on and off so finally left earlier than expected as it just got too much not being able to take more than 3 steps without almost bumping into someone. Very frustrating. Usually it's not that bad during the week but weekends it becomes a place to avoid in my book.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Relax, grab a beer
text: Several beer halls around here, you must plan to see the glockenspiel play.  If you come during one of the holidays, you may even see a parade.

title: } Imponente edificio
text: Probablemente sea el mejor vestigio de lo que fue la historia de la ciudad,la mayorÃ­a de su patrimonio fue destruido durante la segunda guerra mundial, un edificio muy ornamentado de una bella arquitectura pero con comercios en su primera planta que contribuyen a desmerecerlo, actualmente alberga el ayuntamiento de la ciudad.

title: Excellent place to start your Munich expierience
text: Soak it in. this is the center of old town Munich. While it has been rebuilt, you'll never know what was original and what was rebuilt as they preserved the architectual style.

title: Christmas Market 2010
text: This review is based on the Christmas Market Marienplatz as opposed the the place alone.The main square offers a huge array of stalls with crafts and other festive items to buy. But I'd say about 75% of the stalls are food and drink. They operate a fun method if getting glÃ¼hwein, with each stall offering a different style of drink container, from a simple cup with a winter marienplatz scene on it, to a ceramic boot! All the stalls will top up any drinking vessel. You can return your cup for your refund back or keep the item for a souvenir. The square itself offers a great background with all of its historic buildings and the giant Christmas tree looks as festive as you can get at night.Its quieter during the day so if you want an easier life looking round, go during the day for shopping, and then head back at night to simply soak it (and glÃ¼hwein) up! Be sure to visit the near by medieval market too as this offers extra activities, drinking vessels and foods not found in the square!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

text: Central to public transport connections for the airport and the main Munich attractions, this beautiful square is situated close to the old town and within easy walking distance of the Residenz Palace. title: Private trip with my son. "Post- October Fest.".
text: Very nice, clean, quiet family-type hotel. The"Family" adjective is really proper in this case. Excellent!

title: Overrated tourist location
text: Even though there are some interesting iconic historical buildings but overall it is a little too crowded and there are just endless shops. We did not have the opportunity to see the Christmas market which I understand is a wonderful experience. I would recommend the Rischart Restaurant which has an extensive menu and good food.

title: Family trip
text: We arrived on the first day of the christmaskindlmarket and the screne is magical! There are so many beautiful shops and opportunities to have authentic German food.

title: Vacanza
text: Piazza meravigliosa, con tantissimi negozi, peccato che le casette di Natale erano ancora chiuse.Molto caratteristico anche il mercatino alimentare vicinissimo alla piazza.

title: Munich Marienplatz
text: MÃºnich es la capital, la mayor y la mÃ¡s importante ciudad del estado federado de Baviera y, despuÃ©s de BerlÃ­n y Hamburgo, la tercera ciudad de Alemania por nÃºmero de habitantes. Se encuentra sobre el rÃ­o Isar, al norte de los Alpes BÃ¡varos. El lema de la ciudad es MÃ¼nchen mag Dich.

title: Beautiful square, beautiful architecture
text: The square is overlooking the new as well as the old town hall. It is a free attraction. If you go at 11AM, you will be able to see the clock playing a story.

title: Visita Monaco di Baviera
text: Visuale di Marienplatz dal campanile della chiesa di Peterskirche, ovvero la chiesa di San Pietro. Per salire su bisogna fare parecchi scalini in posti alquanto angusti, ma per lo splendido panorama di cui si gode dopo ne vale davvero la pena. La consiglio assolutamente!

title: Una piazza accogliente
text: Bella piazza al centro di Monaco. Da non perdere il carrilon sulla torre de comune nuovo che suona con le figure che si muovono. Orari: 11 e 12 nei mesi invernali.

title: Christmas is on the way
text: We were a few days early, only to see vendor setting up their stalls and not open yet. But the fun of Christmas is just in the air. Nice!

title: Just a Square
text: A square with Europe style buildings. Had a market nearby to walk around. A place where you can truly experience local people lifestyle.

title: Quintessential Munich sightseeing
text: Marienplatz is to Munich as the Eiffel Tower is to Paris. Itâ€™s a mandatory stop on any sight seeing tour of Munich. We usually start here as it the easiest and best place to get off the S-Bahn. Of course, if you want to be the typical tourist you can plan to be there when the glockenspiel puts on the show. We avoid the crowd and arrive after this. In every direction are things to see. Do not be afraid to just wander and find things. Wear comfortable shoes since it is easy to walk miles and still not see everything.

title: Devote some time here and enjoy
text: The area is alive with lots of people, sidewalk cafes and shops. Great place to people watch as it is a true melting pot of visitors from all over the planet. We spent an hour here on a couple of occasions during our four day visit. It was during Oktoberfest so we saw lots of happy people coming and going,

title: Super fun
text: Very busy, lots going on, beautiful architecture. You'll probably end up here without even trying, subways and tour buses go here. A central part of town.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Mittelpunkt der Stadt
text: Toller Platz, Mittelpunkt der Stadt. Kaum ist man da hat man einen atemberaubenden Blick auf das Rathaus. Sowohl bei Tag als auch am Abend sehenswert. Um Touristen kommt man da allerdings nicht herum. SchÃ¶ne Kulisse zur Weihnachtszeit, wenn der Christkindlmarkt seine Tore Ã¶ffnet.

title: Christmas visit
text: Nice place to visit during the Christmas build up, lots of stalls setting up. Plenty of mulled wine on sale and lots of shops open until late. The church on Marienplatz is open during the day for a wander through in peaceful silence.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Medieval place
text: Marienplatz is what draws us to visit Munich . One just have to close his eyes and imagine how life was during medieval times. During our short stay, we came there several times for either shopping or wandering around.

title: Must go attraction in Munich
text: Canâ€™t imagine how to build it! Itâ€™s really incredible! Munich is really good at maintaining historical building!

title: Loved watching the Glockenspiel and wandering around the local markets
text: We enjoyed wandering around the area. The Christmas markets were being set up so was busy with construction. We made sure we were there for 11am for the Glockenspiel. It only operates at 11am and  12pm in winter. There where a lot of little children watching and it was wonderful to see the wonder in their faces. We explored the local food markets. Really good choice of local produce. Every shop you can imagine is also close by
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Discreta.
text: Aunque en estas fechas no se puede apreciar debido a los mercados navideÃ±os, se adivina su belleza. En breve la animaciÃ³n de Navidad se apoderarÃ¡ de ella...

title: Lovely
text: We missed the Christmas Market by a couple of weeks, but they were in the process of setting up the stalls....and I am sure that it will be amazing. The old buildings are very impressive....walk up to the top of the tower at the bottom of the street, 306 steps later, you get a spectacular view of the city. It's knackering,but worth it!!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Mil from the Gong
text: The spiritual heart and focus point of Munchen. Plenty to see and do and is close by to attractions.

title: Gorgeous!
text: This is my favorite part of Munich! Absolutely cannot miss the glockenspiel! We were able to enjoy a drink outside to take full advantage of the experience.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Marienplatz
text: Esse Ã© o centro de Munique, com construÃ§Ãµes que contemplam a Prefeitura da cidade. Parada obrigatÃ³ria para turistas, principalmente prÃ³ximo as 11 horas, quando inicia o show dos bonecos.

title: A must see in Munich!
text: Went to Marienplatz while in Munich on vacation. The amount of old buildings along with the many shopping options is impressive. They have a number of restaurants and the Viktualmarkdt with its open air market and biergarten is close by as well. We didnâ€™t know a lot of the history in advance. If you donâ€™t speak german, I would recommend a walking tour or at least a hop on hop offf bus tour to gain a better appreciation of the buildings and history. I think there are also guided bike tours here as well.A must see if visiting Munich!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Marienplatz
text: Beautiful area in downtown Munich. Full of historical buildings, nice shops and plenty to eat. Worth the trip to see the Glockenspiel and all this area has to offer.

title: A must see place in your trip to Munich
text: Although it was late afternoon my colleagues  and I wanted to have a tour of Munich downtown area. Very nice and the best place to end this visit was Marienplatz. We have taken snapshots  and ended at the trip at a restaurant a bit faraway - quite near Frauenkirche, but it was a very good choice. Marienplatz is a must see point in Munich!

title: A great square to see

title: Una piazza dal sapore tedesco
text: Marienplatz, centro nevralgico della cittÃ  di Monaco di Baviera. Nel periodo di Natale piena di casette in legno per i famosi mercatini e quotidianamente colma di persone che attendono di vedere lo "spettacolo del carillon" ad orari specifici. 11 e 12 si certo il grande carillon incastonato nel nuovo municipio, suona dominando la piazza.Non grandissima ma di grande interesse culturale.

title: Marienplatz
text: Great place to sit, share a meal and a drink, and just people watch.  We didn't see the clock show but loved the architecture all around.

title: Historical and great architecture
text: Lovely churches and surrounding shops for you to spend time to enjoy. The dancing crown on the church would perform every hour and the music would play. Take a breath and stand in the winter time can be challenging. Visit both day and night can give you different perspective of this place !

title: Munich old town square
text: Meeting point and tourist magnet, lots to see and do here, beautiful architecture and some quaint coffee and cake shops, amazing cheese shop with wall to wall Rounds of cheese complete with chutney selections. There is a Tourist Information office located under the historic clock, starting point for the â€˜Third Reich walking tourâ€™ and also the Dachau concentration camp visit. The railway station is adjacent to the central square, bonus no traffic as itâ€™s pedestrianised. Hats off to Ulrich Brilliant guide.

title: Center of Munich and a Must-See
text: The Marienplatz is the center of Munich and is a great starting place for walking tours of central Munich.  The "new" town hall is a spectacular neo-gothic structure.  There are several historical churches and other buildings nearby, and one is within a short distance of the Opera Platz and the high-end shopping districts.

title: Marienplatz
text: In the middle of Altstadt. Nice place to visit for carnival, X-mas market and such things. There is always a lot of people there and listen to the Glockenspiel is nice

title: History.
text: Spectacular place.  Everything.  Food.  Shopping.  History.  I loved the street vendors with chestnuts.  The Christmas Markt wasnâ€™t started yet but would love to come back in December
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Beautiful city square
text: What a great place, even when it rains. Came back a 2nd time for the sunshine.  We went to toy museum, great place. We ate at Donisl, great food.

title: Heard the bells from down the block! Well worth seeing
text: We heard the bells, saw a lot of people looking up and saw the beautiful display up within the tower. A fabulous experience! We didn't go up in that tower but the church across from it so that we could look back to see it!

title: Marienplatz was overwhelming
text: We loved Munich. We saw so much and loved the centralization of Marienplatz. We would shop , eat, and drink around this area. The transportation in Munich is so good that there is no reason to not see so much of Munich while you are there.  Wish we could see this place at the Holiday decorating time.  The buildings and churches are just unbelievablely beautiful and so well kept. We will definitely be back to see more.

title: Great place to hangout. Very busy plaza
text: We walked over to Marienplatz after we checked into the hotel. It was nice to get out into the chilly autumn air and explore. This area is very busy with people hanging out. Visually it's a nice area. Lots to stimulate your senses even if you're just walking through it to go to the train station.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Heart of the city
text: If in Munich I imagine you will wind up here sooner or later.  Great city center and square, lined with magnificent buildings and churches and of course there's the Glockenspiel!  Plenty to do as its lined with stores, food stands, restaurants and much to keep you entertained.  And then there's the farmer's market just off the square which is a must.

title: Il cuore di Monaco
text: La prima cosa che..visiti e l'ultima che vai a salutare prima di lasciare Monaco Ã¨ la Marienplatz. Bellissima di giorno e di sera. La seconda volta, invece, lo spettacolo era ridotto ( non si era mossa la prima fila di statuine!). Da visitare anche i cortili interni e da vedere il ristorante. I think itâ€™s old city hall? ... different architecture, but fantastic nonetheless!

title: Ganz schÃ¶n besucht
text: mitten in MÃ¼nchen, viele Touristen. Eine Toilette gibt es vom Innenhof aus.Liegt in der FuÃŸgÃ¤ngerzone nur mit U und S-Bahn zu erreichen

title: Definitely the heart of Munich
text: Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful.  Every time I looked at the "new" town hall (built in the mid-1800s), I saw a new and gorgeous detail.  Surrounded by old churches and trendy new stores and located at the end of a long, pedestrian-only street, this place is certainly the heart of the city.  Easy to find, easy to get to and easy to meet people at, this is a lovely stop (many times) for your Munich visit!

title: Gita
text: Stupenda...bellissimo i carrilon che suonano..negozi  molto belli e ricchi nei dintorni. Piena di iniziative. Da non perdere
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Spectacular
text: During our visit, we found ourselves in Marienplatz often.  An amazing array of shops, cultural sites and history are presented in this area along with wonderful local food.  A pleasant afternoon in the Biergarten was a highlight of our visits to this area of Munich

title: Wunderbar!
text: The central square in Munich is simply great. A million high-quality places to shop, great food choices abound, amid the scenery that blends the old world and the new. My wife and I loved it.
