title: Cuore della cittÃ
text: Piazza sempre piena di gente. Alle 12,30 c'Ã¨ il bello spettacolo dell'orologio della torre del Municipio nuovo.

title: Ausflug
text: Innenstadt MÃ¼nchens sehr sehenswert Ausgangspunkt zu SehenswÃ¼rdigkeiten und EinkaufsmÃ¶glichkeiten Rundherum GasthÃ¤user und Kulinarischer KÃ¶stlichkeiten. SchÃ¶ne GebÃ¤ude. Sehr stark besucht.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Cuore di Monaco
text: Imperdibile piazza e cuore pulsante della cittÃ  di Monaco. Molto bella anche se purtroppo pioveva e tutto si apprezza meno.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Buena opciÃ³n para un finde
text: Estuvimos 4 amigos un fin de semana. A pesar d la nieve, es una zona con mucho encanto. Restaurantes con vistas recomendables para un brunch.

title: Quintessential Munich
text: This is the square with the glockenspiel, the clock which moves. Check for hours when it goes--it's NOT every hour.  The pedestrian avenue up to the platz is just upscale shopping, and modern, but then you hit the platz itself and it's pretty wonderful with three bell towers (that ring ten minutes before the hour, oddly). I love being there at that time.

title: Tipica bellezza
text: Tipica bellezza bavarese. Giusto mix di storia e modernitÃ . Cuore pulsante di Monaco. Notevole anche lâ€™orologio.

title: Incantevole
text: Piazza favolosa a tutte le ore, punto principale di chi visita Monaco di Baviera,si  riesce ad arrivare tranquillamente in metro, molto incantevole il palazzo!!!

title: 12 o'clock dolls dance
text: Qe visit Munich center and at 12:00 the bells rang and few minutes later the dolls at clock tower started to dance for few minutes. Nice show for children too.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Gorulmeli
text: ArkadaÅŸlarla yaÄŸmurlu bir gÃ¼nde ziyaret etmiÅŸtik. Gotik tarz mimarisi gÃ¶rÃ¼lmeye deÄŸer bir yer. Biz bir kafede de oturduk kahve Ä±smarlamÄ±ÅŸtÄ±k filtre kahve olduÄŸunu tadÄ±na bakÄ±nca fark ettik.  Filtre kahve uzun sÃ¼re bekleyince acÄ± oluyor , eÄŸer sizde bizim gibi kahve eÅŸliÄŸinde bu gÃ¼zelliÄŸi izlemeyi dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nÃ¼rseniz Ã¶nceden bunu sormanÄ±zÄ± tavsiye edeyim .

title: A Happening Place
text: Everything in Old Town MÃ¼nchen somehow gravitates here.  Historic, iconic, a happening place, the heart of the city, a great hang-out place for eats, shops, even just to watch the world go by.  Like most visitors, we waited on a very nippy day for the spectacle of the noonday revolving figurines:  The Glockenspiel in the tower balcony of the Neues Rathaus or the New Town Hall, resplendently neo-Gothic.  On September 19, we witnessed the locals loudly singing and cheering for Bayern Munich and the pro-Serbian fans singing and cheering Crvena Zvezda, with Munich police in full-battle regalia to make sure all kept calm & peaceful.  Bayern won the UEFA championship then!  Electric atmosphere!  Another day, we had a sumptuous meal @the Ratskeller MÃ¼nchen restaurant sampling great German fare in very well-appointed surroundings.  We also enjoyed the many shops in and around the Marienplatz!  We loved every minute we were @Marienplatz during our stay.

title: DecepciÃ³n con el carrillÃ³n
text: Plaza cÃ©ntrica en MÃºnich donde se encuentra el ayuntamiento y se puede ver el espectÃ¡culo del movimiento del reloj que se encuentra en su fachada.No merece mucho la pena la espera.

title: Beautiful Platz in the heart of Munich
text: Honestly you get out of the subway station into this place and the building around is amazing, the level of detail in the City Hall is beautiful. You get to walk around, get food, you have free WiFi, but souvenirs, and walk to different old places from here.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Favolosa
text: Bellissima piazza con piÃ¹ cose da vedere una vicina allâ€™altra, il palazzo principale sede degli uffici del sindaco e amministrazione comunale, la torre con i carillon Ã¨ fantastica, abbiamo potuto vedere il movimento dei personaggi alle ore 11, tutto molto suggestivo, e poi câ€™Ã¨ il vecchio municipio in stile completamente differente. Troviamo la statua dedicata alla madonna , carina la fontana del pesce. Svoltando si trova la chiesa di San Peter ed alle spalle il mercato Viktualienmarkt.Ci sono tornata piÃ¹ volte Ã¨ una piazza unica  che si lascia ammirare sempre
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: TrÃ¨s belle place, posez-vous boire un verre pour admirer la faÃ§ade
text: Passage obligatoire sur cette place mythique qui voit dÃ©filer des (dizaines ?) de milliers de personnes par jour. Donc le bain de foule est garanti.Installez-vous sur une des terrasses pour boire un verre et admirer la faÃ§ade de la nouvelle Mairie de Munich, tout simplement Ã©poustouflante. Pour les personnes Ã  lâ€™heure, le fameux Glockenspiel dâ€™une durÃ©e approximative de 5 minutes vous amusera Ã  11h et de nouveau Ã  12h.

title: A super spot to people watch
text: A lovely little square to people watch and grab a drink, a bite or an ice cream.  Forgot about paying for washrooms. It has been awhile since i was last in Europe.  Make sure you have a euro or two.

title: Il cuore della cittÃ
text: Meta principale di Monaco, piazza incantevole con ai piedi dell'imponente Neue Rathaus dove all'interno si vede il noto Glockenspiel, un simpatico carillon. Cuore della cittÃ , sempre affollata e piene di locali e negozietti.

title: Watch the Glockenspiel!
text: Marienplatz was one of the first sights we saw in Munich- the flowers on the building were gorgeous and it was a great way to start our trip in Munich! Definitely have to stop by and watch the glockenspiel!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Spettacolare la piazza!
text: La piazza Ã¨ spettacolare, con il Neue Rathaus e l'Alte Rathaus che dominano. Vari negozi, pasticceria a fare da contorno. Assolutamente da vedere

title: Vor lauter Touristen kaum zu sehen
text: Gruppen Ã¼ber Gruppen verstellen den eigentlich grossen Platz, der immer noch unter Bauarbeiten leidet. Die Fassade des Rathauses ist sehr schÃ¶n, wenn auch nicht authentisch gotisch sondern bloss neugotisch. Alle warten auf das Carillon, das Glockenspiel. Das ist hÃ¼bsch aber ansonsten rundherum nichts als gesichtloses shopping. Ausser bei Rischart wo sich alle eine Krapfen holen wollen. Besuch hier muss wohl sein als Standardprogramm. Aber nicht zu viel erwarten.

title: Il salotto pulsante di Monaco di Baviera
text: Cosa dire di Marienplatz a Monaco di Baviera? Non ci sono parole per descriverla, bisogna  proprio vederla e ammirarla. Si rimane estasiati. Qui i turisti sono migliaia al giorno e convergono da tutta la cittÃ . La piazza Ã¨ dominata da due imponenti edifici, il Neue Rathaus (nuovo municipio) del 1867-1908 con torre alta 81 mt con inserito il celebre Glockenspiel (il piÃ¹ grande carillon della Germania) con 2 ordini di figuranti (in alto per il matrimonio di Guglielmo V e Renata di Lorena del 1568 in basso per la fine della peste del 1515) e l'Alte Rathaus (vecchio municipio) in stile neo-gotico. del 1400. A centro piazza colonna con in cima la Madonna in bronzo dorato patrona della Baviera. Ai lati negozi, pariccerie ed altro. Ovviamente qui Ã¨ tutta isola pedonale. Afondo piazza a destra ci si immette nel grosso mercato cittadino che Ã¨ aperto fino a sera.

title: Midt i sentrum
text: De fleste byer har en stor plass midt i sentrum. Dette er Munchen's plass. Masse folk. Kjempefin for Ã¥ se pÃ¥ rÃ¥dhuset, og planlegg Ã¥ vÃ¦re der kl 11 eller 12 (om sommeren og kl 17) for da fÃ¥r du se et fint klokkespill oppe pÃ¥ siden av rÃ¥dhuset.  Men utenom rÃ¥dhuset, sÃ¥ blir plassen mer som et knutepunkt og lite annet.

title: Piazza da vedere molto bella, curata ed interessante
text: Sicuramente una delle mete principali da vedere a Monaco, abbiamo aspettato il carillon e sicuramente ne Ã¨ valsa la pena.

title: Raining evening visit
text: We walked from our hotel at the Sofitel hotel at Bayerpost to the Marienplatz, which took approximately 15 minutes. We took in the sight and had a wonderful dinner at the Zum Augustiner. It was Sunday, most of the commercial establishment were closed, compounded with the light rain, so the area was not crowded. We spend about half hour admiring the architecture wonder then took a slow walk back to our hotel. Overall, it was an enjoyable visit.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Typischer Touristenplatz
text: Hier ist immer eine Menge los, da kann man vor Touristen kaum ein Foto von dem schÃ¶nen GebÃ¤ude machen.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Stupore
text: Piazza principale della cittÃ . Frequentata costantemente  da centinaia di persone. Strutture ricettive che si affacciano sulla piazza per mangiare.  Palazzi  storici e chiese sul perimetro fanno godere la vista. Merita di essere visitata, si arriva facilmente in quanto servita dai mezzi pubblici.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Lijepo
text: Jako lijep i uredan glavni trg. Predivna katedrala, i odlicno mjesto za popiti kavu. Cijene vise nego u drugim restoranima no top pozicija.

title: Reminded me of Grand Platz in Brussels
text: Visited MÃ¼nich for just one day. Sadly, it was a Sunday. Not much open. However, buy yourself a nice German beer and enjoy the plaza

title: Tiendas y tiendas
text: Si quieres comprar es el mejor sitio porque estÃ¡ lleno de tiendas , lo mÃ¡s tÃ­pico es un corazÃ³n echo galletas para llevarte de recuerdo

title: VERY IMPRESSIVE Plaza
text: This plaza is located in the CENTER of the Munich RING.It was so MUCH MORE than I expected and the ARCHITECTURE of the buildings was GRAND.  Everyone was just standing around and Taking in the Beauty of the Plaza which did NOT even have a FOUNTAIN.There were booths with local merchants selling everything--food, flowers, wine, candy, home-baked goods and more.Plus there were many souvenir shops and specialty shops around the plaza.Go and ENJOY for YOURSELF!!!

title: Lovely city
text: We visited for 3 days late October and the weather was kind to us. The transport system round Munich is excellent and so cheap. Marienplatz is a lovely part of Munich with lots to see and do. Highly recommend you visit here.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: One of the most inspiring square in Europe
text: If you are in Munich also for few hours you cannot miss the magic of Marienplatz. The square is surrounded by old fashioned buildings and shops. In the middle of the square there is the municipality building with the famous Glockspiele, one of the biggest carillon in Europe. It plays at 11,12 and during spring and summer at 17. After the visit don't forget to visit the market behind to taste typical Bavarian foods and drinks
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Gotta go
text: Lots of shops and the buildings lit up at night are amazing. Plenty of people and plenty of places to eat.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Il centro di Monaco
text: Da vedere e di passaggio per le diverse mete.Il suo campanile, il Municipio vecchio e nuovo, i negozi e lâ€™atmosfera internazionale di questa cittÃ .

title: Stunning
text: Love this square (platz). The glockenspiel is captivating....make sure you are there at 11 am, noon or 5 pm to witness the show. Walk into the courtyard and see the gargoyles up close. There seems to always be music in the air--either church bells or talented musicians busking. A very strollable square, restaurants and shops are right there. The old rathaus (townhall) is also in the square....having been rebuilt after being razed by WW2 bombing, it appears newer than the 150 yr old new rathaus which was built in the neogothic style (contains the glockendpiel)
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Hay que estar
text: Es el centro neurÃ¡lgico de la ciudad de Munich y resulta imprescindible visitarlo y encontrarte con:1.- El nuevo Ayuntamiento de la ciudad. Espectacular edificio de estilo neogÃ³tico con una torre a la que se puede subir y disfrutar de una completa panorÃ¡mica de la ciudad.2.- El carillÃ³n del Ayuntamiento. EspectÃ¡culo de mÃºsica y danza todos los dÃ­as a las 11:00, 12:00 y 17:00 horas.3.- El antiguo Ayuntamiento de Munich, de estilo gÃ³tico y con mÃ¡s de 500 aÃ±os de antigÃ¼edad.4.- La columna de Santa Maria que se instalÃ³ en la plaza el aÃ±o 1638 para conmemorar el fin de la invasiÃ³n sueca despuÃ©s de la guerra de los 30 aÃ±os. Los cuatro angelotes representan la victoria sobre la guerra, la peste, la herejÃ­a y el hambre.5.- Fisbrunner, una pequeÃ±a fuente neogÃ³tica destruida durante la guerra en 1944 y reconstruida posteriormente,  que la utilizaban los pescateros para mantener vivos los peces antes de su venta.Cinco en uno, al margen de otras cuestiones que ofrece este cÃ©ntrico lugar.

title: Marienplatz
text: Der Marienplatz in MÃ¼nchen, der Mittelpunkt der Stadt, ist als Ausgangspunkt zum shoppen ideal. Mit der U-Bahn kommt man zu diesem Highlight am besten. Auch sollte man sich hier  das Glockenspiel am Rathaus nicht entgehen lassen.

title: Volk, schÃ¶n, edel
text: Immer voll, Leute aus aller Welt sind hier zu treffen, sehenswert, Rathaus,  spielzeugmuseum, trinken.....
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Nice, but crowded
text: It is one of the most visited locations in Munich. It is nice, but nothing compared to the main square of cities like Prague or Brussels.

title: Great place to visit
text: You need a full day to visit but this place is so beautiful and great place to eat, shopping and watch some amazing old buildings
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Wonderful week in Munich
text: Marienplatz is the focal point of several blocks of pedestrian streets  lined with stores, restaurants, and attractions.  The New Town Hall with the Glockenspiel and the Old Town Hall with the Toy Museum are in the Marienplatz as well.  It's a great place to wander around.

title: Esperaba mÃ¡s
text: Un lugar central e imperdible, pero no me deslumbrÃ³. Le faltÃ³ encantÃ³ comparada con otros lugares de Alemania. De noche es muy activa, mÃºsica callejera de nivel. Aunque los edificios no estÃ©n artÃ­sticamente iluminados, vale la pena una pasada cuando cae la noche.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Touristischer Mittelpunkt von MÃ¼nchen!
text: Am Marienplatz ist es sehr lebendig und voller Menschen aus aller Welt. Das Rathaus hat verschiedene Baustilepochen durchlebt, wodurch es einzigartig und wunderschÃ¶n ist. Wenn man in MÃ¼nchen ist muss man den Marienplatz gesehen haben.

title: Awesome place
text: We love this old square and the charm and history.  Spent an evening relaxing at one of the cafes and drank beer and enjoyed the view.  Favorite place to soak in Munich atmosphere!

title: Good starting point
text: It is a good starting point to explore Munich. It is just another square with lots of people. Nothing much.

title: Not a fan

title: Now I know!
text: Wonderful place to start a tour of the city.  See the cathedral and the Residenz all right there.  Be sure to check out the jewels in the Treasury at the Residenz.

title: Tremendous architecture
text: This is the plaza in Munich, the buildings are awesome. The area is very crowded, and there can be protesters around. That being said the restaurants were great.

title: Munich's Landmark
text: One of the must visit when you are in Munich. It can be very crowded during the football season. Good for strolling while looking at the stores and restaurant nearby. Directly accessible with train.

title: Old meets new
text: This place is a must!Put on your top 10 places to visit while in Munich We saved this place for our last day to do some shopping and sight seeing.You must visit Dallmayr to buy chocolate, coffee, pastries or to dine if hungry. The marionettes come to life at clock on city hall. Check for times so you donâ€™t miss.Have fun!

title: Interesting and lively location
text: Not easy to find amidst a maze of streets. No tourist signs to assist. Was able to see the glockenspeil and the hop on hop off bus passes nearby. There is a food market near here and a cheese shop. If you like kitchen gadgets there is an excellent store in the vicinity. The buskers were fascinating. The tourist information centre is located here.

title: Carina ma niente di particolare

title: City Center
text: Marienplatz is a central square in the city centre of Munich, Historical buildings , big pedestrian area & a ton of restaurants & shops . Must Visit

title: Need to see
text: The central part of Munich with a big pedestrian area & a ton of restaurants & shops. Touristic but every one needs to see it once. Great cathedral & you also need to see itâ€™s clock ringing at least once. If the weather is nice, itâ€™s a nice place to sit & watch the world go by.

title: Nice square
text: Itâ€™s a nice square to be and visit once with mix of old and some refurbished structures. Nice old buildings, churches lots of shops in this area, cafeâ€™s. Beautiful place to be to know history related in Munich, in short not be missed out there is also beer gardens near by.

title: Mix of old and new
text: Marian Platzl  in the old town of Munich , a very busy and diverse part of the city combining the modern with the old The Rathskeller is a masterpiece of 18 century architecture with tall spires and amazing clock  which has a classic clarion with dancers etc . There is also a darker side to the platz. There is a plaque on the wall of the old Rathskeller which makes mention of Kristalnacht,  My German isn,t great but I think it states that Kristal nacht started in the plaz.  The plaz has many street entertainers and no shortage of restaurant to suit all taste. This is a not to miss area.

title: MÃ¼nchen
text: Very nice place in germany  and People gather here for events in the city center and shopping centerThis building is considered to be the province or municipality of Munich

title: Worth a visit
text: The Marienplatz is worth visiting especially the New Town Hall which contains the Glockenspiel which is great entertainment on the hour.Great views can be obtain via two lifts inside this building.Marienplatz is easily accessed via the underground railway or Hop on Hop off bus.

title: Like the Grand Place in Brussels only crazier
text: Marienplatz is on every tourist's must-see list I'm sure because it seems like they were all there.  Including us, of course!  The square is beautiful for sure with its ancient buildings and that famed clock it's just picturesque for sure.And to make it more appealing there are tons of restaurants and shops from small, independent ones to a mall...  My favorite store, Ludwig Beck, has its main Munich branch there so how convenient is that?!  Also across from Ludwig Beck is another favorite:  Hugendubel. bookshop.  Between Ludwig Beck & Hugendubel I am heaven.  Anyway, I'd recommend not eating on the plaza itself as it's tourist central.  Go a short stroll on the sides or in back as there are more restaurants not so touristy.  And there is also a local market selling all sorts of fruits and vegetables as well as flowers and cheeses, nuts, meats a few steps away from the square.  Worth a walk to see what's still a part of an authentic tradition.

title: Vacation
text: Great all around... don't miss out on the beer garden...the beer garden  is a must  across  from beluga chocolate  store...
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Amazing show
text: We stumbled accidentally by exiting the subway and watched a beautiful show of the clock. Definitely recommend coming here early and getting a good spot to get your camera ready for a breathtaking, detailed, amazing show.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Centre of the town
text: This platz is popular with the tourist because of the chimming clock tower.Go when it chimes and watch the various characters rotate.Plenty of tourist around so beware. Pickpockets have been reported around!

title: Marienplatz is a must-see!
text: Once youâ€™re in the historic downtown Munich area, one thing you have to do is watch the glockenspiel at 5 PM!  (there are other times but I havenâ€™t watched it then!) You will hear the clock chime and watch the figurines come out.....This is very historical and very charming! So plan on meeting your friends here at five and then going to dinner from there!

text: The first day in Munich, we went walking down Marienplatz and there was so much to see. If you go far enough, you turn left and arrive at the Hofbrau Haus, which was wonderful in itself. This was a great experience.

title: Beautiful Area
text: Must visit when in Munich.  Beautiful buildings, always love to watch the clock, too.  Architecture is just beautiful and a fun place to visit.  Crowded for sure, people just hangout.  On Sunday it was extremely busy and nothing is even open except for restaurants in the area.  It is always nice to see "Sunday" being a day for family.  Used to have that in the USA when I grew up, not anymore.  Pretty sad when you think about it.  Nice to be in Europe and see how different somethings are.  I recommend this area when in Munich.

title: Very Busy Historical Square
text: Naturally during Oktoberfest, one of the most sought after and historical sights in Munich would be very crowded!  Marienplatz is a beautiful square flanked by the Gothic spectacular Neues Rathaus housing the famous Glockenspiel. Like everyone else, we wanted to see it chime - everyday at 11:00, 12:00 and 5:00pm (not at 5pm during the winter months). Luckily, there's plenty of room for everyone to stand and view the tower and, if you're willing to film it for 12-15 mins, you can watch the chiming again at home!  Pop into the Rischart cafe beforehand and buy yourself a delicious Bavarian almond pretzel while you watch the entertaining spectacle!

title: Old city area with lovely architecture
text: Most certainly a must do for those coming to Munich for tourism. Enjoyable during the day for the attractions but just as enjoyable lit up in the evening with less crowds.

title: History
text: Superb place, lovely structures. Must visit place. With lots of Historic pages. Mind blogging place.

title: Lovely City for walking
text: We had an awesome view of the Glockenspiel in Munich. Although it was raining, we were able to sit at an outdoor cafe, and watch and listen to the lovely Glockenspiel music while the various figurines moved to the music.

title: A busy square

Recommend sitting in the later evening and letting your feet relax.

title: Awesome!

title: Great for watching hordes of other tourist
text: The primary attraction is to watch the Glockenspiel on New Town Hall at 11am, noon and 5pm. Otherwise, this is the primary hub for tour operators to gather their flocks for setting out around the city. If your timing is good and you can score a table at one of the cafes fronting the square, you can while away a couple of hours watching the sea of tourists ebb and flow.

title: Go at Midday (12pm) to see the clock show
text: The architecture of the Rathaus at Marienplatz is absolutely amazing. There are a lot of tourists there but rightly so.There is a clock show everyday at midday and it is such a unique experience. The adult life-size figures in the clock tell a story while you watch it and it's like nothing I've seen anywhere else in Europe.The show lasts about 10-15 minutes. There is also restaurants surrounding Marienplatz so you can also get food while watching the clock show.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Prachtig plein
text: Heel mooi plein met prachtige gebouwen en goeie vibe. Absolute must in MÃ¼nchen. Het klokkenspel om 12 uur met de bewegende beelden is erg leuk. Doet aan Praag denken.

title: Sightseeing in Munique.
text: On our trip in Germany we were also on the â€œMarienplatzâ€ or â€œMaria's Squareâ€, this is the  square in central Munich, who has been founded in  the year 1158. In the center of the square is the Column of Mary erected in the year 1638, which gives its name to the square. In the square is Neues Rathaus, the new neo-Gothic town hall with a famous clock and carillon. Also different restaiurants and cafÃ©es. Nice location but you have to inform you about the correct time to see and hear the carillon working.

title: SchÃ¶nster Ort in der Innenstadt
text: Der Park ist sehr weitlÃ¤ufig und mit seinen GrÃ¼nflÃ¤chen sehr schÃ¶n angelegt. Auch am See kann man sehr schÃ¶n sitzen und ein kÃ¼hles GetrÃ¤nk zu sich nehmen. Bei schÃ¶nem Wetter laden die Wiesen fÃ¼r ein Sonnenbad ein. Abgerundet wird ein Besuch durch Betrachten der Eisbachwelle, die eine echte Attraktion an einem Ende des Parks darstellt.

title: Beautiful square in shopping district
text: I enjoyed hearing the bells from all the churches nearby, and of course seeing the glockenspiel is interesting. Great people watching area, though not enough seating and bathrooms hard to find

title: Ein Platz voller Leben
text: Am Marienplatz ist es immer sehr lebendig und voller Menschen aus aller Welt. Das Rathaus hat verschiedene Baustilepochen durchlebt, wodurch es einzigartig und wunderschÃ¶n ist. Wenn man in MÃ¼nchen ist muss man den Marienplatz gesehen haben.

title: Estupendo sitio, con el edificio del Ayuntamiento precioso
text: Centro de reuniÃ³n viajeros, edificio del Ayuntamiento una preciosidad, plaza muy accesible desde los distintos lugares

title: Fantastic area,lots of great restaurants.
text: A fantastic square boasting a huge cathedral and great architecture all around.We visited the Ratskeller bar and restaurant and also the Hofbrau House, both fantastic.If you have time there were also some great looking shops!

title: Amazing and full of life!
text: Must visit. Make sure to watch the clock tower show at 12 Noon.Great for shopping as well with various brand including United Colors of Benetton.Must try the grilled chestnuts.

title: das Glockenspiel vom Rathaus darf niemand verpassen

title: Like the old Town of Munich
text: So much to see and do in this area. All attractions are here. Great when the clock comes alive at 11am and 5pm.

title: beautiful
text: Very beautiful place to sit and have beer.Full of people and music..You cant miss the free walking tours that start from there.

title: Glockenspeil? No I can't spell it...
text: Oh my! What a gem! This whole area of Munich is mind blowing. The bells rang and the show started a little before 11am. And what a fun oversized coo coo clock experience!

title: The Vibe of Munich
text: Take a seat, look around and enjoy Munich. City Hall, churches, the smell of fresh baked goods and the sound of German.

title: Bellissima piazza

title: It is a beautiful place to visit. A MUST if you are in Munich.
text: It is a beautiful place to visit. A MUST if you are in Munich. Old buildings totally restored. The surrounding area loaded with beautiful shops and attractive informal Restaurant. Really good...!

title: Main plaza in old Munich
text: Please do not try to drive to get to this site....parking is so horrible and expensive.  The plaza was a nice open area and the main attraction is the glockenspiel.  It is good to go there, but few people really do much but take a picture and leave.

title: Munich, Bavariaâ€™s capital
text: Munich, Bavariaâ€™s capital, is home to centuries-old buildings and numerous museums. The city is known for its annual Oktoberfest celebration and its beer halls, including the famed HofbrÃ¤uhaus, founded in 1589.

title: My Favorite Plaza in Munich
text: Was in Munich for 3 days - this was within walking distance of my hotel near the train station.  The clock alone is worth the trip from the USA! Was lucky enough to hear it chime at 12:00 on my last day in town.

title: Vacation
text: A wonderful city to tour.  Plenty of shops and great restaurants. A must is to watch the Glockenspiel and the beauty of the structure. Also, several churches to visit.  Be sure to walk around in the marketplace.

title: #1 Place to Visit - City Center
text: Marienplatz is the actual Square but it seems to be more than that, the area around it is part of it.The boardwalk leading to the Square has a lot of stores and a few restaurants.From the Square you are within walking distance of the Gardens, Cathedrals and other attractions (Rathaus).The Square itself is just a Square, but it connects all of the attractions around it.The area is definitely the must-visit tourist spot in Munich.You can easily spend a whole day walking around (stores are closed on sundays).

title: Must See Heart of Old City
text: A must see tourist site if youâ€™re visiting Munich. Expect large crowds in good weather, especially around noon for the glockenspiel event, which is definitely a highlight that visitors should experience. Lots of shops, restaurants and churches surrounding the plaza for visitors.

title: A great place to shop
text: There are several large department stores and great places to eat here.. it is open spaces so you will get wet if it rains.

title: Munchen
text: La piazza di Munchen Ã¨ un luogo che ti dÃ  capire che sei in Baviera. Bello l'orologio, da vedere alle ore 11 ed alle ore 12 il movimento, e tutti gli edifici presenti.Peccato che stanno sparendo i negozi tipici bavaresi per dare spazio alle catene....

title: Tourist centre of Munich
text: The biggest square in Munich contains a host of tourist attractions, dominated by the enormous gothic Rathaus, with its famous Glockenspiel. There are two fountains, the Mariensaule topped by its golden statue of the Virgin Mary and the Fishbrunnen with its huge carp. The square also has the toy museum (Spielzeug) on one side and is surrounded by shops, bars, cafes and restaurants, of which the best is the huge traditional Bavarian eatery, the Ratskeller under the Rathaus. A magical place, but a very crowded one and also an absolute paradise for thieves and pick pockets, so be careful.

title: Crowded!!
text: There's TONNS of tourists here, especially during the so called theatre show that plays every now and then. But there are some nice restaurants around that have good seating outside. My suggestion is to just walk 50 meters from Marienplatz, and get a much more cozy atmosphere.

title: Beautiful City Center
text: The Marienplatz is a must-visit when you're in Munich. Beautiful architecture and nice atmosphere, where bars and shops are located.

title: "A Great Shopping Mall"
text: The street is lined with shops featuring items from all over the world. In the center is the church with what looks like a  huge coo coo clock system. Across the street are at least 3-4 fabulous places to eat. Lowenbrau House and the Augustiner are two of my favorites. The dates profile doesn't match my travel experiences... I've been there many times, the last during Oktoberfest in  2001.

title: Oktobertfest 2019
text: Very nice location with several churches within the plaza.  Very touristy location with lost of shops and restaurants around the plaza.

title: Location panoramica
text: Caratteristico peculiare Posto consigliato per la sua Veduta panoramica sulla cittÃ  interni curati creati per accogliere singoli o comitive di persone grande spazio a disposizione

title: Historical, Interesting and Central.
text: I happened to select a hotel within walking distance to Marienplatz.....and how lucky was I! It's an easy metro ride after getting off the airport train and central to many of Munich's iconic locations. The pedestrian mall is a great spot to sit to relax and people watch. There are countless restaurants and shops close by and places of historical importance are within walking distance too.

title: An old town with new looks
text: After the bombing in third world war most of the buildings have come up as small replicas or new ones. But the square retains its old world charm and its history. The town halls are a beauty to see.Not to be missed

title: Center, but not crowded
text: Well, you just need to be there during a rounded hour in order to see the clock playing together with dolls!

title: A must visit attraction
text: We have been to Munich three times now (once just passing through and twice for extended stays).  All three times we have walked over to Marienplatz to check out the nearby markets, churches and the glockenspiel that's a part of the exterior of the City Hall.  If you understand any of the local history, the chiming of the glockenspiel and the movement of its characters tell a uniquely local story.  It's interesting to watch all of the tourists and tour members taking videos and pictures of the glockenspiel in action.  Having seen it three times now, I must admit to being somewhat underwhelmed by it all, but when in Marienplatz....!  There are other attractions nearby- shops, a farmers market, restaurants and churches (including one with a bejeweled skeleton enclosed in a glass coffin).    When in Munich - this is a place to visit.

title: Compras! Compras! Compras!
text: Principal praÃ§a de Munique. O coraÃ§Ã£o e onde fica a Igreja mais linda e imponente da cidade. ImpossÃ­vel nÃ£o se impactar com ela. Rodeada de lojas e comÃ©rcios.

text: Preciosa plaza de Munich donde estÃ¡ el maravilloso edificio del Ayuntamiento. Parece una iglesia, pero no lo es. La plaza en sÃ­ es divina, pero tambiÃ©n lo son todas sus calles adyacentes, con mucha gente y mucho comercio. Pese a ser el centro de la ciudad, la sensaciÃ³n de seguridad es total, cosa muy de agradecer. Si caminas un poquito, llegas a Vikrualenmarkt, unaplaza llena de puestos de flores y artesanÃ­a muy interesante. Visita obligada en Munich

title: FERVIDA
text: Marienplatz Ã¨ il cuore di Monaco. bella piazza centralissima, con la famose torre del carillon dove si possono vedere le figure animarsi e ruotare alle 11 e alle 12. ricca di macellerie gastronomiche che servono anche stinchi , wursell, panini e birra ovviamente... da qui si accede anche alle tre chiese maggiori e ai mercati.

title: Love it
text: Lovely atmosphere and defunately the place to visit. Lots of nice restaurants to choose from. Interesting artists.

title: An amazing visit with extraordinary architecture.
text: If you time your visit correctly you will have the absolute joy and pleasure of experiencing the church bells with the running of the glockenspiel. 11 AM and 12 noon daily. Also in the spring summer and fall at 5 PM. The glockenspiel does not run  during the winter at 5pm as was shared with me by the tourist center. The center itâ€™s self is vibrant with activity. Many restaurants, shops, and businesses within the platz and on the outlying side streets. Also the main tourist information center is located in the platz itself.

title: Loved this for 48 years
text: I always go to Marienplatz to watch the town hall carillon. Times are in the wall beneath it. Have seen it since I was 8 and still love to see which knight wins the joust.

Molto carino il carillon sulla torre del neus rathaus che 3 volte il giorno suona la sua canzoncina. Dalla piazza si accede facilmente alle tre chiese piÃ¹ importanti di monaco. title: Beautiful area filled with plenty to do.
text: If you are in Munich, it will be very hard to miss this area. 100% have to see though. It is a beautiful square with restaurants, bars, shopping, and even things like a pharmacy. There are typically street performers and cafes. This is basically the main hub of Munich and you can spend hours here alone. The buildings are beautiful and the architecture is so cool. Great for a cool backdrop while you grab some coffee from the open air cafes.

title: Beautiful Platz
text: Very centrally located for Munichs sights.Lovely buildings and a really good buzz about the place.Just off one side is a market, along with eateries and a wonderful outdoor drinking area with loads of trestle tables surrounded by trees.It was busy all the time, you join a small que, pick up pre poured beers and pay the man on the way through,brilliant!

title: Bellissima

title: Beautiful Marienplatz in Munich, Altstadt!
text: This is one of the most beautiful plazas in Europe.  The buildings are structurally amazing.  The clocks with musical and dancing toys come to life three times a day and it is fun to watch.  The whole area is always so crowded with tourists taking photos of the buildings and clocks and waiting for the few minutes clock show.  There is also a food market very close to the plaza with lots of great food and beer places.  We spent hours walking in Marienplatz area, Kreuzviertel, Theatine Church of St. Cajetan, and Court Garden and other areas of old town Munich.  It is a charming city with good food and good beer.  Our dinner, pretzel, and beers at Hofbrauhaus Brewery with an amazing Bavarian atmosphere were fantastic.  Visit the place when you are in Munich.

title: Rain or Shine - this plate is alive
text: Shopping, eating, people watching or admiring the glockenspiel, this is the place to be!  The platz is the meeting place for many groups and tours so it provides an international people watching stage.

title: An afternoon guided walk
text: We spent a pleasant afternoon on a guided tour of part of the old city around the palace. We started and finished in Marienplatz at 5pm to see and hear the clock tower chime.

title: Il cuore di Monaco
text: Punto centrale di una stupenda cittÃ , a due passi dalla piazza del mercato e raggiunta dalle lunghe vie dei negozi. Marienplatz ospita il caratteristico Ã¨ imponente quanto spettacolare palazzo del municipio di Monaco, davvero maestoso da osservare. Subito dietro lâ€™angolo della piazza Ã¨ possibile giungere nellâ€™altra piazza del mercato dove trovare tanti prodotti tipici da acquistare o da gustare seduti al tavolo di uno dei tanti chioschi e ristoranti. Dallâ€™altro lato lunghe vie di negozi di ogni genere, aprono la strada verso il centro. Marienplatz tappa moralmente obbligatoria se volete poter dire di essere realmente stati a Monaco!!!

title: Stupenda

title: A wonderful place
text: I came to Munich for the Oktoberfest! Marienplatz is in the middle of the altstadt, the old city. The Germans rebuilt this city according to what it used to be. Many buildings have lots of history in them if you want to do a little digging.  But you also can just appreciate the beauty of them, along with good food and beer! Prost!

title: Lots of Activity
text: This was a national holiday, so lots of people about. Felt safe, enjoyed street musicians, sidewalk artist, and cooked chesnut  kiosk.

title: Absolutely Beautiful
text: One of the most beautiful gothic style buildings I have ever seen in my life! The detail is unreal! Beautiful area to shop in. Many shops of food, sweets, coffee, shoewear, clothing, souvenir shops etc.available. Would definitely recommend to shop and eat here, as well as sighting seeing all in one!

title: Center of Munich
text: Marienplatz is the center of it all! Very nice square. Great to see the Glockenspiel. Fun hub of the city.

title: A must see experience
text: This square is bustling with tourist, entertainment, and everyday working people. There are many shops and restaurants here as well. The energy is very vibrant.

title: Fabulous atmosphere!
text: Lovely time spent here during the day and night.  Lots of street entertainers to see while you enjoy lunch or a beer at one of the outside restaurants.  Plenty of places, museums to visit.  Go see the Glockenspiel Clock at 11am, 12pm or 5pm to watch the statues move or go right to the top for a view of the city.

title: Nice but not must-see
text: We were requested to meet at Marienplatz to gather for a city bike tour (excellent Mikes Bike Tour). Marienplatz is an easy to find and central location for our first trip to Munich.  The square is large and surrounded by standard shops cafes etc.  The central focus of the square is the large glockenspiel that draws hundreds of visitors for the show.  It is impressive and worth seeing if you are in the area.  I wouldnâ€™t lose sleep if we didnâ€™t see it though.  Good place to meet up with people or to shop or eat.

title: Remarkable Architecture in Munich
text: One of the classic Munich sights with remarkable architecture, pretty hanging flowers, and the Glockenspiel tower. Worth a drive by sightseeing, but otherwise not much to do.

title: The heart of Munich
text: The Marienplatz is a great place for tourism in Munich. Nice place to buy souvenirs and  to spend the day with other tourists. The tours office is located here as well.

title: A beautiful place
text: A lovely place full of historical architecture, shops and restaurant. I love to visit it early in the morning, afternoon and before sunset. You will find many musicians and activity during the day. A must visit while you are in Munich.

title: Beautiful
text: If you are planning a trip to Munich, late September is the best time to go.  Oktoberfest in bloom, the weather is temperate and cool.  The people and spirit intoxicating!In the middle of it all is Marienplatz.  The setting for the Rathaus and amazing clock tower.  Every hour people stop, stare and listen to the chimes and action of the tower.  A sea of cell phones rise up to capture in video the experience!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: A little shopping
text: Marienplatz was in walking distance from our hotel, The Charles.We strolled down the historic streets on the morning we were leaving to go home and it was a delightful way to spend our last morning in Munich.

title: Marienplatz is a must see for anyone coming to Munich
text: Marienplatz is a great place to visit. It is full of beautiful architecture and history. Walk around and see the sights with a tour or solo.

title: Great square
text: In Munich visiting various outdoor markets and the town square. Beside the town square is the town hall as well. Make sure you go up the elevator in the clock tower to get a great view of the square and surrounding area.

title: Be there at noon
text: The concert bells are played at noon. Actually a couple of minutes past 12. It lasts for about 10 minutes. Itâ€™s very well done and easy to see and hear all over the square even though a lot of people will be there. Many restaurants in the square. They are a bit expensive so if you want to save some euros you can easily find other nice places in the neighbourhood.

title: Great starting point to see Munich
text: Marienplatz is absolutely gorgeous! Try to go at 11 am or 5 pm when the giant clock of the Rathaus will be playing (moving figures and music). Marienplatz is a great central area of Munich, within easy walking distance of multiple churches, the Viktualienmarkt, Hofbrauhaus, cute shops, a toy museum, etc! You can easily spend a day or two in this area of Munich alone.

title: The place in Munich
text: You canâ€™t help finding it and itâ€™s a must see for the Glockenspiel show. But also take a look around the square and the immediately surroundings. So much to see here and I only a few blocks.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Most popular
text: Marienplatz is the central square in Munich enclosed by New Townhall and Old Townhall and attracts visitors in hordes. It has many popular restaurants. Frauenkirche and Hofbrauhaus are close by.

title: Spend some time here
text: Restaurants, shops and history. A must do while in Munich. It is the town center. Spend a few hours here and have lunch or dinner.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: A PLETHORA OF THINGS TO SEE!
text: Sitting and having a quite brunch, lunch or afternoon tea is the way to drink in all that is around you by visiting the Marienplatz.  So much to see and do in this lively area.  The Glockenspiel is the main attraction inside the "old town" and according to some, it is a "must see".  Would have been an absolute marvel during its time, however the waiting for this old world "wonder" seems forever and while it holds character, there are other more attractive things to explore. Many tourists gather around to watch and take pictures of its workings.  From memory the clock performs twice a day - once at 11am and the other (I think) at 2 or 3pm. There are plenty of shops for those who are into retail therapy, lots of cosy and quirky little cafes and many side streets that also hold a wonder of different attractions.  The Old Town is definitely a "must do" when visiting Munich.  So much history and architecturally beautiful buildings.  A good way to spend a day or at least a full morning or afternoon, depending on your itinerary.

title: Nicr
text: So we really enjoyed seeing this building st night.  The lights, the details. All very nice and if youâ€™re lucky to see the music and characters come out wow worth the timed visit.

title: Molto bella
text: Bellissima e ampia piazza centrale di Monaco, naturalmente pedonale. Su di essa si affaccia il palazzo del municipio, con la sua torre ed il bellissimo orologio. Da vedere

title: Great square and people watching
text: Great location, centrally located.  So many shop and trinket stores to occupy your time.  Can walk to everything.  On a beautiful day it great to sit outside and enjoy a drink, ice cream, and people watch.  So many people from so many countries in one please.  It was amazing.

title: Great for people watching.
text: People watching is great. The reaction of the crowd is worth being there for a second tim to watch the Glockenspiel. Have a beer and just enjoy sitting in the sun.

title: Lively place to enjoy a drink
text: Marienplatz is constantly busy with tourists and locals, and will be particularly packed at 11am and 5pm for the Glockenspiel. It's worth braving the crowds to watch the entertaining display. Grab a coffee or snack at any of the cafes surrounding the square while you wait.

title: Stupenda!
text: La piazza Ã¨ veramente spettacolare, la torre dell'orologio la domina. Ad orari stabiliti il meccanismo si mette in funzione e si anima.

title: A must see!
text: The Marien Platz is the center of the 'old Munich' and is a pure delight to see - the underground trains have this as a goal from all over Munich and some streets are off limits for cars giving a sense of a wide open mall.  The plaza is named after the mother of Jesus, Mary, and a golden statue hovers about the very large open square.  Shops and stores and restaurants abound - the famous Hofbrauhaus is an easy walk  10 minutes away.  I enjoy the Rathaus restaurant which is down a long stairway to an underground place for a snack but for sure a delightful lunch or dinner.

title: Beautiful setting
text: Beautiful setting with the obligatory tourist price gouging. The clock movement on the hour is famous worldwide.

title: Plaza principal de Munich
text: Sin duda un lugar que hay que visitar, es una plaza preciosa llena de histÃ³ria, no se puede perder la parÃ³dia del reloj, es el ayuntmiento de Munich, no una iglÃ©sia ni catedral. A las 11, las 12 y las 17 el reloj hace su parodia. Lo mejor para conocer parte de la historia es quedar con un freetour en la plaza.

title: Piazza centrale

title: Shouldn't miss it
text: This is really the center of all that is the city.  From the fish fountian to the Glockenspiel (plays at 11:00am, noon, and 5:00pm)and the many shops and restaurants on, and around the square, this is an excellent starting place for a discovery walk in Munich.

title: Perfekt Location

title: Marienplatz was enjoyable
text: Really enjoyed strolling around Marienplatz.  Went there twice during our stay.  Best place for people watching.  The old city hall was beautiful.  All the different stores and outdoor cafes and the market were all great.  Would recommend it to be the first place for people to visit in Munich.

title: The more we visited, the more we enjoyed!
text: We've read many reviews where folks suggest you can do Munich in a couple days - for us, we spent two weeks and found ourselves back to the Marienplatz area 6 or 7 times.  Each time we explored another direction off center.  Lots of great food, great drink, and the people watching is entertaining in itself.   Take the time to experience, not just pass through.   We had numerous meals / drinks here, watched the Marienplatz show several times.

title: Der Mittelpunkt in MÃ¼nchen!

title: The heart of Munich
text: My wife, son, daughter and I visited Marienplatz in August 2019.  We took the airport train straight in to the Marienplatz S-bahn stop.  I have not been to Munich since 1983.  Marienplatz is still fantastic.  We watched the Glockenspiel performance at 11 am at New Town Hall (Neue Rathaus).  We visited several churches.  We went shopping.  I was amazed that the Marienplatz that I saw was similar to the Marienplatz that I remembered from my first two times in Munich a long tme ago.

title: Start your visit here.
text: Be here at 11A.M. to see the famous glockenspiel in the tower of the New Town Hall. Go up and view the city from its tower. Several tours originate here. Take a walking tour which leaves from in front of the Visitors Center. The subway from here is an easy ride from the airport.

title: No visit without Marienplatz
text: The heart of Munich and the perfect pace to watch people/characters. Plenty of shops and of course the city hall.

title: Ambiente familiar
text: Siempre que vayan a Munich, aconsejo pasear por esta area, tiene buenas tiendas, el mercado oftece variedad de frutas, tambiÃ©n puedes conseguir buenos souvenirs.

title: Great Place to People Watch!
text: One of the main public areas in old town Munich. Large plaza lined with shops and restaurants. Just wish they had more chairs and benches to sit on. Seats are at a premium, snatched up as soon as one leaves one!. This large plaza continues with shops and restaurants along a corridor to Karlsplatz and Hauptbahnhof where Karstadt department store is located. All nine (9) u-bahn lines meet at Marienplatz.

title: Eindeutig das Herz der Stadt
text: Rathaus alt und neu, wichtige EinkaufsstraÃŸen abgehend und auflaufend, unten diverse U Bahnen, oben das Glockenspiel. Auch wenn man wahrscheinlich nicht nicht vorbeigehen kann lohnt es sich.

title: One of the few historical attractions in Munchen!
text: An average old city square. Some action is always happening there. A lot of tourists, pretty much garbage, a couple of cafes and shops. It is situated at the end of the long pedestrian shopping street.Two beautiful buildings- Old Town Hall and New town hall. The New one attracts much more attention of course. Come and see why! ;)

title: A hub of activity!
text: As soon as we got to Marienplatz we were greeted by the chiming of the New Town Hall glockenspiel clock tower. Amazing!Marienplatz is an subway stop and adjoins  Viktualienmarkt which is another must visit!

title: Must see when in Munich
text: Wonderful area to eat and shop. There are many churches and outdoor fun. Clean sidewalks and great place to get clothes before Oktoberfest. Go get lost and enjoy all the markets and Biergartens!

title: Day out in Marienplatz
text: We had a full day enjoying this wonderful part of Munich. Wonderful buildings, great shops and excellent bars and cafes. Easily accessible on the underground, very pleasant indeed.

title: Beautiful but crowded
text: Marienplatz is beautiful and easy to get to on the bahn. There is a lot to see and a lot of shopping and dining choices. It's best to get there early as the crowds build during the day and it is far too crowded in the late afternoon.

title: The Germany we were expecting
text: We really enjoyed walking around Marienplatz. Old buildings, the town hall, cathedral, the famous Glockenspiel, markets, Jewish memorial etc and lovely architecture. Waiters dressed in traditional dress. There are upmarket stores if that is what you want, they are just like anywhere else. Definately worth a visit.

title: Al centro di monaco
text: Salve sono stato con mia moglie e mia figlia piccola  ad agosto ,che dire non troppo grande pero molta bella con marienplatz che e il centro e da la Si vista tutta la citta ogni strada porta da qualche altra piazza , da vedere anche il mercato dove si mangia a tutte le ore , da non farsi mancare i boccali di birra veramente stupendi ,quindi a piedi la visiti tutta ,uniche zone fuori mano lo stadio ,i giardini inglese e il parco giochi all aperto molto bello comunque e una citta da vedere consigliata .....

title: Walk about
text: Was in Munich for a day and visited marienplatz which was a nice place to visit. I arrived just at the end of the bells chimes and the show in the tower it had a lot of people there to see the show. I did not get the history of the place but I'm sure it was interesting

title: A MUST SEE
text: It is the place to be if you are going to Munich.  Take a trip up to the top of the Marienplatz to see the view it is amazing.  We were constantly warned to be aware of pick pocketers, we were very aware of our surroundings and no issues.

title: Must to visit
text: If you are in munich you should visit this place whichbis the city centre and full of cafes and reatauransts and retailers and department stores

title: Beautiful Area
text: Marienplatz is a beautiful area with lots of shopping and cafes. Once can just walk around this area and it is very lively.

title: Beautiful Square..
text: This is a very beautiful and busy square. Located in the heart of the old town, its a lovely place to be when its a sunny day and there are loads of people about. The large Rathaus (the New Town Hall) is beautiful with its Glockenspiel shows at 11am, 12md and 5pm. Do go to the top of the tower to get an amazing view of the city. Its a great place to stop, have a coffee or beer and people watch.

title: Excellent glockenspiel!

title: Great place to visit
text: We toured the main spots of Munich, which included Marienplatz. As we toured ourselves, we didn't know a lot about Marienplatz and were delighted to be just in time for the Rauthaus-Glockenspiel show.There were quite a few other tourists there to watch the show as well, with plenty of room for everyone to see. We later found out the show is offered 3 times a day in the summer and lasts around 15 minutes. If you are in the area, check it out as it is something to experience.The rest of Marienplatz square contained shops, restaurants and street performers. There is also an option to pay a fee to go into Marienplatzand climb the towers however we did not opt to do that on this trip.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: It's a great place if you are culturally or somehow connected to here
text: It's a nice place to "reconnect" with your culture, provided you are of the "right" culture. People are quite aggressive here, not very respectful. If you are not of the "right" person, you can dress well, be very pleasant, spend money and still be treated poorly.  I was denied service in several places on the Marienplatz.  It's a place for people who are from there, or of the "right" type, then you will enjoy it.  If you are not of the "right" you know what, you won't be treated well.  At most they well tolerate you.  All that friendly stuff is pretty phony otherwise.  Yes, if your ancestors came from here, it's great.  You will enjoy it.

title: Wonderful place to visit
text: This is a fun place to visit, even in the rain.  There are lots of shops, churches, and restaurants in the area.

text: Nice square with old and interesting buildings. The new city hall, that is actually old, is beautiful and has the most interesting clock. title: Superbe tour nÃ©o-gothique
text: L'ancienne hÃ´tel devant la colonne Mariale cÃ©lÃ©brant la victoire sur les troupes SuÃ©doises, garde une odeur de poudre. On peut croiser des joutes violentes au sortir de la guerre de 30 ans, les SuÃ©dois sont mis en fuite cela nous Ã©pargnera l"insupportable Greta Thornberg.

title: Watch with hand on your wallet
text: The clock does it's thing at 11 and noon.  There are tons of people mulling around with all their eyes pointed upwards, just be aware of who is next to you!  Had a guy come stand very close to my husband, I looked right at him, but he didn't move, then we moved 3 steps away - and he walked away.  I'm convinced he was going to pickpocket us.   The clock show last about 10 mins.  First the parade by the happy couple and a joust, then the lower have of the dancing men.  The rooster crows at the top at the end and easy to miss.  It's worth a look and fun to hear the crowd react to the show.

title: Munich Christmas Market on Marienplatz
text: It is amazing, you must try this, once in lifetime. You can taste street food with local speciality and to drink hot wine. We spend such lovely days before Christmas, there are a lot of tourists, the city is full o lights and the market full o beautiful accessories for Christmas tree.

title: Busy street round the clock
text: Very famous destination in Munich for tourist and it is known for many street celebrations in front of the church. There is a market nearby where you get some different types of Wine (very famous during winters).

title: Town square
text: The square is located on Munich's central tourist street. A special attraction is the bell tower with the clock and the moving figures, the biggest show being at noon

title: Main Square
text: Main square at the heart of a lively pedestrian zone. This is where the New Town Hall is and the Glckenspiel is. There is lots of shopping and places to eat.

title: Marienplatz
text: The architecture and old world ambience are absolutely amazing.  I could have walked around here for days.

title: Old world charm discovered during a layover
text: I had 11 hour layover at Munich Airport, and I decided to spend it at Marienplatz. It's at the center of the city and only 45 minutes on the train from the Airport. While you are there do not miss the Beer at the viktualienmarkt. Take the streetcar from one end to another to see the city views.

title: Excellent spot to relax.
text: The square has everything you want.  Amazing architecture, excellent restaurants where you can sit outside and enjoy the sights, tons of shopping.

title: HERMOSA
text: Una hermosa plaza rodeada de comercios y restaurantes,en la fachada del edificio principal se encuentra un reloj con figuras que se mueven creando un ambiente de consternacion en los visitantesLuego todos siguen caminando con absoluta tranquilidad y seguridad aunque el lugar esta repleto de personas el ambiente es muy seguroMusicos amenizan el lugar con sus virtuosas habilidades dejando a todos detenidos por placenteros periodos de tiempo donde te transportas a tiempos donde hace mucho tiempo los habitantes de este lugar disfrutaban del clima y la belleza que ofrece la plaza.

title: City Centre
text: The heart of Munich towered by the town hall and the fascination of the glockenspiel! Plenty of restaurants and shops in the vicinity

title: IL FULCRO DI MONACO
text: Bellissima piazza che incanta. Facile da raggiungere con la metro praticamente in piazza. Edifici bellissimi. L'orologio storico Ã¨ meraviglioso.

title: Nice European City
text: Very nice to walk around and see the sites. It's quite a typical European city so take that for what it is.

title: Lovely square
text: Love Munich, love Germany! We enjoyed the Beer Garden's atmosphere and the band music. Plus, the Church in the square and fantastic architecture, food in the market was also a bonus!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Fun place to visit, awesome historic buildings
text: Marienplatz is the central square in the city center of Munich, Germany.  It has been the city's main square since 1158, and is within walking distance of the Hauptbahnhof which was near where I was staying.  Visited several times on my trip to Munich. There is so much to see and absolutely recommend just walking around for at least a few hours to absorb the culture, history and beauty. Close to any number of open markets, lots of nice coffee shops, bistros, restaurants and shops., outdoor beer gardens, etcâ€¦ Not to miss there is the Glockenspiel.  The architecture is just beautiful.

title: Large shopping area
text: This and all the surrounding area has great shopping and history and culture. This is also where the bike tour started that we took.

title: A Lovely Place to Explore
text: I loved strolling this pedestrian-only plaza.  There are many shops and restaurants to explore, as well as beautiful architecture to admire.

title: Excellent
text: Stunning, great shopping with lots of cafes, markets & surrounded by magnificent architecture. Great place to people watch!

title: Gorgeous plaza
text: This Plaza was amazing. We waited for the glockenspiel to start and watched all the movements. It was amazing and not to be missed.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Pretty good sized square!
text: Itâ€™s the central location so most of the shopping etc is accessed from here, there is also a Tourist Information office (very helpful people) & a metro station. Itâ€™s a large square & there is normally some street entertainment on during the day & night. Thereâ€™s also the clock that people go & see, itâ€™s not really worth it to be honest.

title: Piazza principale di Monaco
text: Marienplatz Ã¨ la piazza principale di Monaco di Baviera; zona pedonale con locali per bere e mangiare e nogozi per lo shopping. La piazza Ã¨ molto ampia e piena di gente, turisti e non. Si affaccia il Palazzo Municipale con la sua Torre con orologio e carillon con statuine; a seconda della stagione ci sono orari differenti in cui assistere allo spettacolo del carillon: le statuine girano al suono di una melodia. Si puÃ² salire sulla torre dell'orologio. Tappa obbligata per chi visita Monaco.

title: Heart of Munich
text: Great place to stroll. Donâ€™t miss the glockenspiel at the new Rathaus, 11am. Great shooting as well, look for authentic Bavarian products, there are plenty of places to find them.

title: Da Norimberga a Monaco.
text: Piazza suggestiva su cui si affaccia il Palazzo Municipale, maestosa struttura con torre. Quest'ultima Ã¨  visitabile dall'alto da dove si ha la possibilitÃ  di ammirare uno splendido panorama con visuale 360 gradi della cittÃ . La torre inoltre Ã¨  dotato di un orologio che alle 12 ed alle 17 mentre scandisce l'ora offre delle rappresentazioni sceniche effettuati da statue di soggetti mobili.

title: Tappa obbligata
text: Piazza bellissima molto luminosa solare vi consigli di aspettare il giro dell'orologio. Ãˆ un peccato essere in questa piazza e non veder girare l'orologio. Lo spettacolo dura circa 5 Min. Noi siamo saliti anche sulla Torre dell'orologio, non e molto costoso con 4â‚¬ x adulti e 1â‚¬ i bambini sopra i 7anni. Consigliatissimo

title: Stunningly Pretty
text: I didnâ€™t know what to really expect on my trip to Munich but I absolutely loved it!  The architecture is breathtaking and we found numerous pretty squares to enjoy a drink or a bite to eat.  The people we met were so friendly and happy to engage in conversation.  The infrastructure is amazingly efficient with trams and a wonderfully efficient train service and the area in general is classy, elegant and beautiful!  Loved it!!!

title: Bella non molto grande
text: Municipio molto bello con la torre dellâ€™orologio che suona alle 11.00 con un bel movimento di statuine. La piazza non Ãª grande ma molto viva

title: El corazÃ³n de MÃºnich
text: Es la plaza principal de la ciudad. Es muy bonita y merece la pena verla de noche. Desde allÃ­ se puede ir a la mayorÃ­a de monumentos o zonas de tiendas.Es de las partes que mÃ¡s me ha gustado.

title: Kann man kaum auslassen
text: Am Marienplatz kommt man in jedem Fall mal vorbei, wenn man in MÃ¼nchen einkauft oder durch die Innenstadt spaziert. Der Platz ist fast immer gut besucht, es hat viele Leute. Teilweise machen Strassenunterhalter ihr Programm. Die anliegenden Restaurants sind insgesamt gemÃ¼tlich. Wer weniger Rummel mag, wird einen Ort in einer Seitenstrasse bevorzugen.

title: Stupenda
text: Con la sua immensa cattedrale, rappresenta il cuore pulsante della cittÃ  Bavarese. Sempre affollata a tutte le ore.

title: So much to see
text: We visited several times on our short trip to Munich. There is so much to see and absolutely recommend just walking around for at least a few hours to absorb the culture, history and beauty. The Glockenspiel is also one to watch, it plays I think at noon, 1500 and 1700. It's amazing and worth standing amongst the crowds for. The tourist information centre is located right there where you can get maps of the city. The market is just around the corner, as is the famous Hofbrauhaus. The Marienplatz is also walking distance to several S-Bahn stations, so worth walking to a few if you can to see more of this amazing city.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Shopping
text: Very crowded.  Hard to find an authentic German restaurant.  We did stop at an Italian one and it was good.

title: Enjoyable visit
text: This place is a walking distance from Hauptbahnhof where we are staying... lots of shops and restaurants around, outdoor beer gardens, etc. Not to miss there is the Glockenspiel which we happened to be standing by at 11am after shopping at nearby galleria... we had a pistachio gelato in the square as well which we enjoyed. We visited St. Michael church, itâ€™s lovely inside, very ornate. If youâ€™re looking for WC or toilet, thereâ€™s a McDonaldâ€™s nearby.

title: Metallica Gig
text: Beautiful part of town, spoiled for choice. Plenty of Shops, Restaurants, Bars and its very central, Transportation is very good loads of options to get around the City. Beautiful Buildings and Arches, keep your wits when crossing Roads though, some Drivers dont need the Green Man!

title: A place to go
text: Central square of Munich fully backed by tourists and locals. Close to open market, surrounding by nice coffee shops, bistros, restaurants and shops.

title: Il cuore di Monaco
text: Marienplatz Ã¨ il cuore di Monaco. Luogo di incontro per turisti e per abitanti del luogo. Ãˆ qui lo struscio, passeggiate, negozi e ristoranti e anche qualche protesta pacifica.

title: Centre of action
text: This is the heart of the city where every one go . All the old buildings are impressive. Lots of cafes that serve lovely Bavarian deserts

title: Wonderful clock from centuries ago
text: Go see the clock at 5 pm to watch the clock mechanisms move and rotate. Really cool to see stuff still working with technology hundreds of years old.

title: If your In Munich come here
text: This is such a wonderful hotspot for tourism. Filled with restaurants, old gothic buildings and impressive cathedrals - Marienplatz is where you want to be. Its comparable to Krawkow in Poland. Only thing is there is a lot of construction as a good amount of the city is in restoration. Regardless you'll want to come here to dine and wine.

title: Beautiful old buildings
text: Around this square there are a number of beautiful old buildings. While some are repurposed as high end retailers and food places, it is still free to look around. U-bahn and other transport services are close at hand.

title: Fun place to visit
text: The Marienplatz was a fun place to visit. To see the old and new, to hear the glockenspiel, to wander through the shops was all great!  Many tours leave from this area so it is a great starting point to your Munich journey.

title: Awesome place to visit and take in the history
